review: The salad is usually brought before your food. Not ours so that meant our burger and fries got cold. Just a little dressing not enough for the salad. No drinks refilled even after asking. Bottomless fries forget it. A small handful of fries and you get no more even after asking. Service sucked. Wonder why I left no tip. You have to earn it. If you ask me everything was over priced because server never brought refills. We won't be back.

Waited an hour and 1/2 and never got seated. We had a party of 14 and arrived at 4:50 pm.  We came early because there were so many of us but no one else waited anywhere  near that long. We were willing to split into 2 groups but they just kept us waiting until we gave up. They couldn't even tell us how much longer we would have to wait. We had small children with us so we picked up fast food and went home. So much for a family celebration.

I took my mother out to celebrate her 50th birthday, and although we were served cold food(burgers and all) by a server that didn't give us his name anyways... BK, the manager on duty fixed it and made sure we left with a smile on our faces. Even got dessert to let my mom eat since she didn't get a birthday cake this year! Now the funny part about all this was when the server asked "How's everything?" Once we took our first bite. I with all the bravery in the world took one of the onion rings and pressed it against his hand asking if he thought it was cold. He nodded, with concern... And said "Yeah, that IS cold..." And so was our burgers dude.  Anyways.. Thanks Red Robin. The food was great, and the mistake was fixed professionally. We will be back, I ain't giving up on y'all yet.

I used to work for this company and I do not like how they treat their employees. So I am always hesitant to dine at Red Robin and support this company. But I wanted to write this review because of our server Tony. He was SO pleasant and just all around awesome! He was super busy and he still gave us exceptional service.  I had my kids with my and he brought out fries immediately for them and was quick to get us anything we asked for. He was polite and had a great attitude!  On the other hand, our meals were good except the chicken in my BBQ sandwich was pretty chewy. That's why 4 stars and not 5.

I must say that during my last visit here the service was great. Our waiter was nice, answered our random questions, and checked on us consistently despite him having like 5 other tables, each of which had bigger parties than us. I tried the mad love burger with chicken and it did not disappoint, it was very tasty. I like that you can switch proteins so easily here (beef/veggie/chicken). I even asked for the ancho marinated chicken and they happily obliged. My overall dining experience here was better than it typically is @ the location I'm used to going to (Sun Valley Mall). I'm sure I'll be back.

Went here for lunch on Veteran Day.  The lobby was packed and there was no sign of a host/hostess.  We waited for 10 minutes before a server came the front to call on a party to be seated.  The server did not make eye contact nor did she attempt to address me nor any of the other groups that were waiting to have their name added to the wait list.   About 2 minutes later, still no hostess, however a second server came to the front to seat another group.  As the server was grabbing menus, my wife asked if we could add our name to the wait list.  The server replied "The hostess is in the back" and quickly walked off to avoid any further conversation with my wife and other patrons who still wanted to add their names to the wait list. Not to mention, the lobby was dirty on top of being in complete disarray.  Won't be going back anytime soon.  Too many other good options in Rocklin/Roseville area to eat at.   I have also removed myself from their loyalty club. Go to the Habit, Smash, or In and Out.

The food here is always amazing. Travis was my server and he was very attentive and was chatty with our table in the best way possible. I would love to come back and sit in his section next time here!  There was a hair in my burger. I've eaten at Red Robin countless times and this is the first time this has ever happened to me. Travis fixed the problem immediately and was very apologetic. He brought me an ice cream and took the burger off my bill. This won't effect my view on Red Robin, I know that mistakes happen.

Literally the worst experience I've ever had ever. Long story short, our waitress Marissa started this time off saying she remembered us from last time and made lots of passive aggressive comments when we asked for things like "unlimited fries" enough for 6... or water, or silverware, or ranch we've asked for 10x, all normal things... later, one meal came 20 minutes earlier than all the others and she had an excuse for why this isn't her fault. There was an excuse for everything and she never ever took responsibility for the awful experience. When we got our food over an hour later, I found a TOENAIL in my soup. Completely ruined everyone's appetite. I've had poor experiences here before, but I will never go back (not that this will put Red Robin out of business). The manager offered to comp half the meal, but it should have all been free. That's a health hazard and no one should ever go here, ever.

I'm in town for several weeks and trying out as much of the local fare as I can. If you like hamburger joints with an impressive list of options then this seems like a place to try. Unfortunately, the success of any business can be attributed to its employees and with so many choices in the Roseville Galleria area this is especially true. Surly service, an inexperienced bartender and ho hum meal did me in. It's unlikely I will be back, to this or any other Red Robbin.

Really the first time disappointed here. I tried the chimi queso special burger. Either they left some things off or it's a really tasteless burger. The aoli seems like the real flavor bomb but I could t find any. The tomato was also MIA. I sent it back.

I am giving this a 1 star, only for the fact that I received a horrible dining experience to compare all others to.  The place was half full, no wait. Server was high as a kite. Figity, no eye contact, impatient, not talkative. Spilled my drink on the tray before I got it. Got cold hard fries as a appetizer. They were out of chicken fingers for my kid (after he took the order), food took 45 min to arrive. Had to ask for place settings. My prime rib dip was cold and soggy. Cold fries again.   Talked to the manager because the server was nowhere to be scene for 5 min. He got me a new meal. Checked that it was good when it came out.  The server asked what was wrong, so I told him. He said,"that's not on me" and pointed to the kitchen.  10 min after we were done eating, with our plates pre-bussed on the table, I had to ask for the check. After I wrote the credit card slip out with a 15% tip, I was putting my card in my wallet and it was nearly broken in two! What a f*ck face! I had enough.  $75 for $hitty experience... My RR loyalty card went in the trash tonight.

This place needs to step up their game! Waitress was rude and took forever to bring our food. When asked for more fries, she gave a pzzled look as though she did not understand what "bottomless fries" meant.. Hope they get better...

We had a party of 8 come in here today.  The service was pretty slow.  Usually I'm a fan of Red Robin in Folsom, but this was my first time at the Roseville location.  Unfortunately, it was disappointing.  The burger I was so excited to try was super dry - the bun and the patty.   Other than the fries, nothing was that impressive. Carson C. Granite Bay, CA

I'm simply not a fan - of this or any other Red Robin location.  I can find a much better burger joint within blocks of most large chain burger joints. No localization and no individuality.  Red Robin isn't very interesting.  'Gourmet' is a stretch. Always crowded, always noisy, always a long wait for food.  For an average burger, its not worth it.  I go when others choose it as the place to be. They do turn tables quickly so the wait to be seated isn't so bad.  A recent lunch whistle brought a few family members together for lunch as some were passing through town; six of us and a young'en.  A fine job done catering to the youngest of youts, ours and of others about the place.  It's good for families and meh for 'gourmet' burgers. The menus were incomplete, missing pages.  Utensils for three were brought to our booth of six.  I don't know.  I could go on.  These simple 'things' go overlooked and make a big statement.

I had a to-go order yesterday - did the curbside pick up - which was 15 mins late.  Put my order in an hour before to be picked up at 6:15. Arrived to find the order not prepared yet. They finally brought the food and I rushed to work the nightshift. By the time I had lunch it was after midnight and couldn't notify them that my order was wrong and I didn't get what I paid for.  I called today and they apologized.

Pretty much sat around waiting for service the entire time. I had to go get my own silverware, and napkins. The server Rachael R was obviously busy, however, abrupt and rude with quite the bad attitude. When I asked if I could please put an order in, she said "you can order and appetizer, but you'll have to wait to order your food until I come back with your drinks." Ummmmmm what? OK.....later we had to flag down the manager to get a refil.... Bottomless fries never came, the salad I ordered came out incorrectly.... It was all around an unsatisfing experience.... If you want to spend 15 dollars on a burger, I would suggest doing it somewhere else.  Two stars because the interior was updated and nice, and the actual food that made it to the table did taste good.

From the moment minute you walk in, you feel like turning around. First thing you see is the door handle is filthy! Disgusting. Say down in our booth and the glass partition was covered in food and hand prints. The whole restaurant felt dirty. If we hadn't been waiting and weren't so hungry, we would of left. Never again!!
I ordered this from doordash - horrible portions McDonald's would've been a better choice

Hostess was friendly and we were seated within 20 minutes on a very recent Sunday afternoon.  Food came pretty quickly for our party of 6, but my issue was the lack of customer service skills from our waitress. So much attitude was given, it was a very uncomfortable experience.
Our waiter kept messing up the order; although he was very apologetic. It took more than an hour before my family was finally served.

I love the great food here, the environment, and the service. My wife and I go here at least once or twice a month either in a date or going out with friends. Not only is the food great but I have never once had an order wrong. Plus if you're looking for a place to order on line and take home this is the best resturants for that.  We have done it numerous times and our orders are always done with excellence and it's made fresh and fast. Love this place and it will continue to be the one place that we go to a few times a month. Plus the bottom less fries are the best.

I came here on a busy Saturday night around 7:30 pm. It was slower than any other place in the Roseville area. We tried another establishment and the wait was 1 hour and 15 minutes. Ya, not waiting for that. On the other hand Red Robin only had a 15 minute wait. Works for me, along with the bottomless fries!  While we were waiting my nephew needed a diaper changed. My brother and I went to go change his diaper in the men's restroom. This place had a changing station in the men's restroom! While this isn't the most impressive thing regarding this establishment, it is a plus. I have heard of men's restaurants and other establishments that aren't courteous to fathers.   Onto being sat. We waited a while for our server, Javan. It seemed like he was busy. Running around and taking care of multiple tables. He was very polite and genuinely nice. He gave us a heads up that he would be right with us and then eventually apologized for taking so long. By that time we were ready to order. We each ordered our respective burgers and drinks. My brother and I ordered the Guinness milkshake. It was really good the first round. You could barely taste any alcohol. The second round wasn't as good but you could take more of the Guinness.  Javan was somewhat on the slower side, but I'll give him credit for trying. It was also a Saturday night. Can't expect the best service on one of the busiest nights of the week. We wanted fries as our appetizer, he forgot to give it to us and we ended up receiving our meals. When it comes to Red Robin you don't really eat your burger. Take a few bites but load up on the fries. Since its bottomless fill up on the fries, take the burger to go and heat it up when you get home. Fries don't microwave well; on the other hand, my burger tasted just fine. Otherwise Javan was great, really nice guy. We ordered our second round of of fries and it came promptly. We eventually asked for the bills and boxed and paid soon thereafter. The host opened the door for us when he saw that we had a stroller. Very polite. Overall I would come back here. The restaurant was slower than other places. Endless fries, yes sir!

Came here last night for dinner around 5 so it was not horribly busy yet.  She said 20-25 min wait unless there is open seating in the bar.  Cool we did that.  However we sat there quite some time without menus and wondered if we sat in the right section.  Hubs had to get our menus up front.   Finally our waiter Neil came.  I thought oh boy here we go again with bad service but it was not his fault.  As I looked around I saw that he was the only waiter in the entire bar section and it was filling fast.  He was running around like chicken and doing his best to take care of everyone.  I had said this before, they spread the servers too thin which causes slow or bad service. I knock RR management for that. Servers should only have 4 tables, not 8.   Unto the food!  I usually get my standby mushroom burger but the picture of the mad love burger really appealed to me. OMG!  It was was the BEST burger I ever had.  Hubs tried it and said "Oh yeah you can tell just by the first bite how good it is" It had all this ooey gooey cheese and then a layer of crisp cheese, marinated tomatoes, fresh avocado on a soft ciabatta bun.  It was worth the 998 calories.  I hope they keep this one on the menu. For the first time ever, it was not freezing cold in here.  I was actually comfortable.   Oh and I used my Royalty card and was pleasantly surprised it had a B1/G1 promo on it so our meal was less than $20.

BEST SERVICE I'VE EVER HAD at a Red Robins! I've been to many, but this time around, I've got a fantastic waiter and service was excellent!  My usual order is a Swiss Mushroom Burger, minus the swiss. I love their bottomless fries!!! You get that with every burger order, substitution available if you're not a fan of steak fries. I love their ranch dipping sauce, the two combination of greasy fries and ranch, a match made in Heaven! This time the mushrooms on my burger was plied high! They are usually pretty stingy on the mushrooms on this burger, but not this time, I've got LOADS! Happy Customer!  My waiter was super attentive (his name sounded like Awesome, at least that was what he told me). Checked on us a few times, got refills quickly in a timely manner. Made sure we were taken care of, love that! He'd even asked if we wanted our drinks to go. Never been asked that before! It has been a while since I've been to any Red Robins, but so glad this time I've got such great service, I might return sooner!

My kids like coming here for one reason the onion ring towers who doesn't love onion ring towers. I cringe at Little each time we come in. I just can't get over why a place centrally located in Roseville is so dirty. Every time we sit down the window sills and blinds yup the are still dirty. The table appears clean but always has a greasy residue. Still for the love of my kids I kept coming back. The food is good and I have never had complaints about it or the service. It's just lord have mercy I'm a immaculate mama pleaseeee Red Robin clean your restaurant!

Red Robin is not a bad chain. In my insignificant little opinion, it's one of the more reliable chains for burger lovers. This location USED to be pretty great, but recently I've been less than impressed. Red Robin Galleria has seen some shift, let me tell you. My high school friend was here the night it partially burned down, and thankfully evacuation was efficient. I feel that it has never been the same since. Call me dramatic. 2 recent events caused me to drop this location from a solid 4 (in my mind, apparently I've only written tips at this location?). A group of my OG pallies came in here to celebrate the birthday of one of our number last week....AND: 1. What on EARTH happened to the House Salad? It used to be a thing of crunchy, fresh beauty! What arrived on my plate was a wilted, boring, sad shell of what the Red Robin House Salad once was. SAD! It was once a most beloved pile of lively, ripe greens and veggies, crunchy strip thingies (nowhere to be found any longer), with many bright colors and happy magic sprinkled everywhere. What I got had maybe tomatoes, cukes, and looked like it came from a bag. Ew.  2. Yes, that Dr. Pepper WAS flat. Fix your soda machine. Dr. P is gross as it is, don't cause the increased suffering of its biggest fan by serving ick soda. And please, don't make the customer think you don't believe her when she complains. She did appreciate her free shake, but some customer service tips would benefit the server we had. Yes, we'll fix that, none of this well I checked it and it looks normal bs. No, no, no. Bad bad bad. Service was right in the middle between slow and speedy, and they started us out with a basket of bottomless fries right off the bat. That tells me they've heard the complaints several reviewers have shared, and are trying to improve. We were also blessed with a random gift of sweet potato fries, but it was not clear if this was a mistake or a gift? Thanks! My salad sucked, and my soda was not flat, but getting there with the quickness. No one else had any food issues. I'm not sure if I'll be back at this location unless family beckons. This is a favorite dinner destination of my parents, and since this is usually the reason I come here, perhaps whether I'll be back is not in my hands? Parking Note: Hideous. Designed by agents of Hades. Don't even bother with the shared lot for RR, PF Changs, and Buca. Park in the large lot across the street, behind RR, next to the Verizon and Alfred Angelo.

I came here tonight and sat at the bar - I had a great experience tonight at Red Robin.  I love coming here. Paul was a great waiter and very friendly and personable. He checked on us in timely matters and always used great professionalism. I ordered a cheeseburger with an additional Patty and my date ordered a madd love burger and we also got some mozzarella sticks.  All the food was great. Keep up with the great work paul and Roseville Red Robin.. yuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuum!!!

This chain has gone downhill big time over the years. We really used to like the food but it is getting to the point that we don't ever want to eat here again. Our orders are always wrong or they forget to put items in our take out bag. Last night we ordered food at 10 pm, which I get is late but RR closed at 11, so still have an hour and the place wasn't busy at all. The food was cold and nasty and not to mention nobody even acknowledged us for a while. The management needs to pull it together. The location in Vacaville is the best one around and doesn't even compare to the locations around Sacramento.

Second time doing the Yumm 2 Go. Never again.   Horrible the first time,  worse the second.   Supposed too be ready art 5:31.  By 5:42 sitting there and nothing,  call them they said it's on way out the door.  6 minutes later still nothing.  Call and let me find out. 5 minutes later food comes out and missing 3 fries.  I know it's Friday night but really?  And last time we did this was a weekday afternoon and bad then as well.    Didn't want to eat in tonight because my daughter is sick but she asked for Red Robin. Never again the Curb pickup.

I've tried 3 different locations (Citrus Height, Vacaville and Roseville) and all were the same level of awful. We had a short wait only about 10 minutes. The wait staff couldn't seem to decide who should wait on us so after about 15 more minutes we were taken care of by a guy who said he wasn't our waiter but could get us started on drinks and fries. The drinks came but alas...no fries. They didn't make an appearance for another 20 minutes and there were maybe 10 fries on the plate. Our waitress (who had the personality of a banana slug) finally brought our meals. They were ok...I had the Royal Robin and my wife the Southern Charm. I expect much more from a chain that only does burgers but yet again I was underwhelmed. The whole time we had our meals no one came to check on us to see if we needed anything. Finally a different waitress came over and said our waitress was too busy to check on us so she would instead. Our waitress had maybe 4 or 5 tables and clearly had no sense of urgency about her. After we were done she finally came over to see if we wanted more fries. Since I couldn't afford to wait another 20 minutes for 10 more fries we decided to go. Bottom line...the service is and has always been awful and the bottomless fries are a joke. Don't waste your time on this dump...I don't know how they have been in business for this long.

This might be one of the hardest reviews that I have had to write. Just a reminder this review will be based on eating here on a Saturday night with a group of about 14 people. It all started off pretty good we had a table in about 20 minuets and that was pretty awesome. They even gave us French fries before they took our drink order. You could tell the server was going to be overwhelmed which was a bummer since we really like Red Robin. After about 10 to 15 minuets they took our drink order and the. Another 10 to 15 minuets the sodas finally started to come out. So about this time it was about 30 to 40 minuets from sitting down and they decided to finally take our order. This took about 10 minuets which I understand you want to make sure everything is correct..... So after about another 30 minuets they started to bring out food and you could tell my family members were not impressed as a lot of it was barely warm, but at this point they were hungry and just wanted to eat. This is when my wife and I finally received our food, we were the last but hey that's okay. Well that was until we both had our first bites.... her burger was medium rare and mine was a bit more cooked but still very red for a burger. Yes that ask some pink or no pink, we both asked for no pink burgers. I was so bummed out on how our burgers were still mooing I mean come on, I understand you are in Roseville on a Saturday so you will always have business, but get it together.  The manager took our food off the bill, which is the correct thing to do since we did not eat them and had to leave to feed our 7 week old baby since dinner was already at 2 hours.  So if you are coming her as a party take this into account.  Hopefully someone at Red Robin can help train this restaurant.

Love Red Robin and the food is good and consistent but the staffing is ridiculous. On more than one occasion we have waited 20-30 minutes to be seated because they were short wait staff or tables sat dirty for the entirety of our wait. Management needs to figure it out because the scheduling is horrible and there are plenty of other options within a half mile.

I'm over waiting on my food. How long can it take?! Waiting long enough to finish two drinks. I'm watching my waitress take 4 different orders yet still no food. To add insult to this experience as I sit here starving for a meal they bring us fries! ‍‍‍ that already comes with my burger...where is my burger?! For crying out loud now I see why we always walk out of here! This was the first time we actually had the time to sit down this place is always packed...full of people not getting food in their tables! Sad to say but if my food doesn't come soon I'm just going to leave.

It's not busy. I'm sitting in the bar section. Our server is Racheal Ra. There are 4 tables sat in. We ordered fries as an appetizer and told our server we were starving. Our orders came with fries but we wanted something asap.  We never got our appetizer fries and as we sat there we witnessed a frozen pina colada lookin drink sit on the bar for 10 minutes before a server came up and asked what it was. He looked confused and walked away with it.   We told our server we were fat and wanted a lot of camp fire sauce and we were handed 2 small half full sauces. When we asked for more, we were given one bigger one half full.  We had to order more from the manager since we weren't getting enough from Racheal.  We were given an apology about not getting  our original fries but it wasn't convincing.  Prooooooobably not gonna come back

Two of us, just a party of two... There is a two seater booth that has been open since we got here, yet we are still waiting?!?!? I asked about it and they said it's already "spoken for", what???? I know it's Halloween, but I don't sense any Ghosts here tonight. SUPER irritating! It's been almost 20min so far...

This was the first time I've ever been to this red Robin in Roseville. I am kind of torn between doing three stars or four stars I wish there was the option of doing a 3 1/2 stars. But oh well, I guess I feel it would be more of a three if I had to choose. The reason I did this is because first of all the food was really good but our server was mediocre - Eh..  Let's start off with the area; it's right across the street from the big mall in Roseville. The neighborhood is very nice. Parking could be hard to find when you pull into the lot. Red Robin shares the  parking lot with other restaurants around it.  As we got sat down to our table our waitress approaches us and asks what kind of drinks we want. Everything is normal and going well until I ask her about their bottomless "wedges". for some reason I thought Red Robin had wedges not fries. I haven't been here in a long time so, I had forgotten. and she immideatly said "what???? What are you talking about???" And I said it again, "it's bottomless wedges?" She's like "what??? We don't sell wedges. What are you taking about." Like oh. My. God. Why was she speaking to me in that way. Her tone and her attitude.. all I have to say to that is EWW! She's apparently not wanting to get a tip or something. so I just responded back to okay. afraid if I responded in a harsh way back she might spit into my food. Throughout the rest of the night her serving skills was whatever. I was already kind of pissed about her attitude so I wasn't going to give her another chance.  on to the food: the food was good! I wouldn't say it was the best burger I've ever had but it was yummy! I wouldn't say it was great either. One thing you could choose for your burger was either: little pink or no pink for the meat. My boyfriend and I both choose little pink. luckily, yes it was a little pink. I wish we could have customized it to how we wanted it. preferably I like it as medium rare but it's okay, close enough.

Came in today about 4 pm and sat at the bar. The good : I had the fish and chips. REALLY good fish, cooked perfectly, and bottomless seasoned steak fries. Plenty of tarter sauce on the side. Jennifer was polite, professional, and pleasant. She made sure I had everything I needed, and promptly got my check when I asked for it.   The bad: N/A The ugly: N/A A much better experience here than the Citrus Heights location. My server even made sure to ask if I was a Rewards member ( which they NEVER did at Citrus Heights location). I will definitely be back.

Dad was hungry and he wanted a burger, we were in the neighborhood so I figured, why not. I can't remember the last time I craved a burger, but I do enjoy a chiliburger and RR has a decent one. Now, In most RR I have been to, you can't even get to the door before someone is there, opening it for you and welcoming you to the restaurant. And though the host did greet us when we came in, it was only later that it struck me as odd that this RR didn't do that. In all honesty, that wasn't a big deal. And so, about 3:00 on a Wednesday afternoon, Dad and I are seated in the main dining room and all but a few tables have stacks of dishes on them from what I assume was the end of the lunch rush. I can appreciate that servers who have been working their tales off getting people seated, watered, fed, and cleared for the next cover will need a minute to breathe before clearing away the dirty dishes and cleaning the tables before they had to worry about the dinner rush, but it seemed odd to me that no one came to do it.  I sat down, perused the menu whilst Dad left to use the facilities. He would later report that it was filthy. That's not really acceptable either.  But, as he is not exactly a spry man and requires a walker, it took him about ten minutes, maybe a bit more, to conclude his business and return to the table. In all that time no one had come to the table to ask about drinks.  I am a very forgiving person and when the waiter did come I asked him if they were short staffed. He looked at me as if that were a very bizarre question and asked me what makes me say that. I demurred and mentioned that there didn't seem to be much staff. In all fairness I saw two servers and the host. I thought that it was a logical assumption seeing as the tables had still not been touched. Perhaps this is why we were not offered a table or booth when we had entered. And so we order. Dad and I both got Diet Cokes. He ordered the Southern Charm burger, pink with no mayo no onion. I order the Chili Burger, no pink, no mayo. We get our drinks, fries, and, eventually our meal. I was, in all honesty, displeased with the chili. It looked as if it had been sitting in the warmer and had developed a crust. At least it had cheese. The burger looked as if it had been purposefully charred. Just because I don't want it mooing doesn't mean I want to eat charcoal either. Three minutes on each side of those flat, pre-packed burgers is more than enough time to cook it no pink without turning it black.  And that's when I realize that we were not given knives. Fine, I can cut this with my fork, but it's a little annoying. On the third bite I realize that I'm tasting the chipotle mayo. I don't like mayo, which is why I ordered it with no mayo. Besides, mayo with chili? Honestly? That's just gross.  I peel apart my burger and there's the mayo. I was done. I was just done. We weren't even offered a dessert menu, I guess the waiter picked up on my displeasure. But then, I did leave most of my burger there, and I didn't ask for a box. Even if I don't eat it all, I usually ask for a box to take it home to my dog. She loves my leftovers. From the time we came to the time we left was about an hour and in all that time, not a single table was cleared. If I wanted to eat a burned burger in those surroundings, I could have just cooked at home. So I was not impressed with this restaurant. I have never had bad service, or a subpar meal in any other RR and if this were my first experience with this franchise, I wouldn't go back to another one. 10/10 won't ever come back to this restaurant... even if I did live in the neighborhood.

We love Red Robin. I mean who can't?!? Endless French fries make RR all the better. The selection of burgers is great & pretty extensive.  It seems as though if you can imagine it, they will make it happen.  RR is the prefect place to get together with friends or family. The atmosphere is very young, vibrant, & full of energy.  Another bonus is they have RyR rewards that send you emails with different discounts & free burgers. They also give you a free burger of your choice  on your birthday. The free item is loaded to your rewards account & when you check out, the discount automatically appears  RR also uses a small tablet device that allows to to pull up your check & pay your bill.  It allows multiple people to pay for their own check.  It allows us to pay our check without having to flag down the server.

This restaurant sucks! Go to the Citrus Heights location. The management is horrible. We try once a year to walk into this location and are ALWAYS disappointed. I hope that someday they change management, because it's great food. The service isn't worth the food at this one.

No b. S. here, this place is awesome and a great waitress to boot! Jennifer, our waitress is very upbeat, the burgers also fantastic! Couldn't have had a better experience! They kept on bringing us fries too, so awesome!!

One of the absolute BEST restaurants I've been to! The waiters are really nice and the food is just amazing!! Even though I order the same thing everytime, (LOL) and they even have their own Table Tablets! And their Fries are to DIE for!! As soon as you put them on your tongue, you feel like you're already in heaven! I love going here!

A great day for eating outside. Alfonzo our waiter is fabulous. I have a couple comments for the management. Your blinds need to get fixed and excercise black pants are not to be worn to work unless you are an excercise teacher

I have never had such a horrible experience. We eat at Red Robin in other locations regularly as it is a restaurant that is known to have good food allergy policies. My 6 year old daughter has multiple life threatening food allergies and Red Robin is one of the few places we trust to eat out and we were out of town for the holidays. We told the waiter about my daughter's allergies and asked him to give the chef our laminated prepared card explaining them, but told him as we eat there regularly we knew that what we ordered for her was safe. Macaroni and cheese and apples. Very simple. Everyone else asked that their burgers had buns without sesame seeds due to her allergies, there are several bun options. An  hour after ordering our waiter came back to the table to tell us our order would be out soon "they are just trying to get all that allergy stuff right." It was a Tuesday night and other people who came in after us were already done eating. Mind you we now have three kids, 7 and under crying because they are hungry. The waiter came back 20 minutes later with food other than what I had ordered for my daughter slammed it down and said "well it has the allergy sticks in it so are you going to be ok with it?" Mind you her allergens were on the plate. Every order had sesame buns and there were sesame seeds on plates that didn't even have buns. Half the orders, just regular orders, weren't what was ordered. He said he would be right back and with the correct food. We spoke to the manager who looked like an overwhelmed 12 year old who tried to tell us it sounded like a miss communication as the waiter said it wasn't actually a sesame allergy. I explained the card I had given him and all that occurred. Ten minutes later the waiter comes back and says "in 20 years of doing this I have never dealt with something like this. You are going to have to deal with someone else." AND he walked out of the restaurant WITH our chef card. Then no one came to talk to us until we stopped a very helpful staff member who attempted to straighten everything out, apologized profusely, told us we didn't have to pay for the food we had received and attempted to track down the card which became apparent was gone. Almost 2 hours in and half of us had no food, the others had wrong food and now my daughter has hives.
We had Michael as our server and he was absolutely amazing! He was always there when we needed something and provided great service! He was very polite and knows what he's doing!  Thanks Michael :)

We are fans of Red Robin, it's an old family favorite.  As a Special Olympics Coach, a special shout out to their HUGE support of our athletes and Tip A Cop events that support our athletes and programs. Our family of 10 arrived last night to celebrate MY birthday.  Our server was Jen, she was 5 stars, NO question.  She recommended burgers and entrees, checked on us frequently (and they were BUSY!)  She kept baskets of assorted fries coming to our table.  Our meals arrived timely, no one ever had to ask for a refill, and said HAPPY Birthday about 300 times.  We get into the birthday song, singing and clapping.  She and her colleagues made this night FUN. Two thumbs WAY up, and for Jen...........Best service we've EVER had (and we are Red Robin Royalty!)

Usually we really enjoy Red Robin. We get take-out ordered at the bar in person. Well this time like the last few times in a row they've forgotten to put in a couple sides of sauce requested. But here is the kicker on this last order (yesterday evening).  I got a side salad instead of fries. Well they tossed the salad literally into the to-go box next to my wrapped up burger. No container like usual. Just thrown in on top of the liner paper. Feels gross to me so bye bye salad  not going to eat it served with such carelessness. Feeling disappointed

The beginning of my experience at Red Robin was off to a bad start the minute I walked into the restaurant. Mandy, the host, was absolutely terrible. It was a Friday night so it was pretty busy so she quoted us about 30 mins which was fine. However, I was sitting in a position where I could see her behind the host stand and she would NOT stop checking her phone. The time that I was sitting there she probably checked it 15 times. On top of it she kept talking very loudly about inappropriate topics for work and kept cussing way too loud. The other hosts hushed her several times and she would just laugh if off. Also the other hosts kept yelling at her to do her job because you could tell she was slowing them down by not helping at all. The young gentlemen named Livv was very apologetic when I brought it to his attention and was very friendly. Our server Chase was very friendly and attentive. The food was good per usual. Even though everything else was great we will NOT be returning until that host Mandy is fired.

Half machine, half human. Post Bridesmaid dress shopping, we were all ravenous. We didn't have too long of a wait, but they had plenty of seating for those that did. We were showed to a large booth in the corner. Bless our Server's heart. You know when you stick your foot in our mouth and you cannot recover, yeah, that happened to him! He asked what our big group was doing there and we told him that we just finished shopping for dresses. He proceeded to say, which we know he meant to compliment "All the pretty girls are married." Mind you, half of us aren't married. So then we gave him a hard time from then on. All in jest, but you could tell he felt bad. This doesn't pertain to the food, but as a reminder that we're all human. So, there's a machine at your table where you can order food. So, there's a human that comes to your table and you can order food from him too. It's really weird. Do I tip my normal 20% when the server isn't even doing the work?  I do not particularly care for this chain, but when the Bride picks it, you go. It's not bad, but its nothing special. I'd rather eat somewhere that isn't a chain, especially this one. The burger options are great, but their 'endless' fries never come out crispy when I order them as such. Since they are made on a continual, mass basis...I never get crispy ones. Someone ordered a few appetizers which we all shared - Guac, Salsa, and chips and towering onion rings. They definitely killed the hangry in the group, but they again were just average. Good enough to eat happily, but nothing to brag about. I kept it simple and ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger with regular fries, washed it all down with a Pina Colada. If I know anything, I know these chain restaurants are killer at making these silly drinks...and it was HOT outside so it sounded perfect! The burger was decent, nothing to write home about, but also nothing to complain about. Just an average executed burger. Again, the fries were just like everyone elses, not as crispy as I would have liked. Our server did hook us up, I think as redemption from his comment earlier. He just kept bringing fries, until we told him we'd puke if he brought more. Some of the girls ordered sweet potato and garlic fries, so he brought copious amounts of those too. He was also never short of Ranch for the table. I do know one issue was that he said it was happy hour, but the beers the bride ordered weren't on HH and we didn't realize this until it was time to pay. He should have mentioned that to her when she ordered them. Maybe an oversight or maybe just trying to keep the tab higher, we're unsure. When it was time to pay the machine came in handy. We were able to select our items and pay for just them. With a group of 8 women, that is perfect. It also lets you select any amount of tip as well. I remember there being one screen many of us kept getting stuck on, but I can't remember what it was. It even printed out a receipt for you too. Fancy little gadget, I tell you. Most memorable one liner by a server...

Server is horrible. No personality, very slow and we have to basically tell him what to do....get our drinks, take our order, bring us plates, bring us silverware. I've never had a server so disinterested in doing thier job.

Amazing food! I love Red Robin and actually used to be a line cook for this company so I am extremely picky about my orders and food. I always get my orders Togo as I'm extremely busy and always under a time crunch with multiple jobs. The service over the phone and in person is always great! The food is cooked how I like and expect it to be! Michael helped me with my Togo and brought me a cup of fries while I waited!! Awesome service and food definitely always my go to location

The Great Potato Famine of Red Robin has arrived. Bottomless fries? Not my experience! From reading other recent reviews this has been the experience of others as well. The fries that accompany your burger have been proportioned down to a less than small order dropped into the equivalent of a napkin ring (probably a third of what you used to get with your burger). Okay, fine...if the server is going to keep them coming. My less than small order of fries, however, were in need of a refill after just a few minutes but even after being promised more they didn't materialize. I finished my burger, my iced tea went dry, and even after a long wait to get a drink refill, still no fries. There was a great exodus from Ireland as a result of the potato famine...Red Robin, learn from that experience...just sayin'. My single refill of bottomless fries finally arrived about an hour after being seated when my server dropped off the check and I was beyond ready to escape the potato famine. Something Good:  One of my fave burgers anywhere is the Royal Red Robin. All the components of this burger meld perfectly for a wonderful burgerlicious experience.  When that warm egg yoke breaks and coats the burger it adds an extra creamy dimension to the burger...for those of you that have not experienced it keep an open mind and give it a try! Yes, it's messy so keep plenty if napkins close by. Why two stars? Burgers go with fries like Batman goes with Robin. In this case, the fries (Robin) were hiding in the kitchen. BAM, POW, Holy Fries Lies Batman!

While the food was pretty typical for Red Robin ( Good Stuff! ) The service here was pretty crappy at best.  The host pushed me towards the Bar as I was alone ( yea I get why, but it still annoys me). I saw several wait staff look at me, or point to me, just no one wanted to actually stop by and take my order.  Once I finally got to order dinner, They my order.  The people next to me ordered and received food before he remembered I was there and he came back to apologize for the delay and push the order through.  Did not have any issues with the food, just really poor service..

We came in today around 2pm and they weren't busy in there at all. Took over an hour to bring the food to the table. They messed up my burger more than once. The fries were cold and old. The waiter was purposely not coming to the table to check. Waited 30 minutes for the manager to bring my food back by this point I was ready to just get up and leave. It also came wrong again. My family and I will not be back to this restaurant until they honestly change up their act.

Food was cold, the table had no Silverware, napkins ect, no chance to ask for refills. Had to wait over 15 mins before even getting drink orders in. And 45 mins for fries & food. Just overall very bad service Very sad I've always loved coming here, but that may change.

Honestly, if it wasn't my granddaughter's favorite restaurant. I would never go there. We were seated, the server (obviously overwhelmed) got  our drink order and 20 minutes later she returned for our food order. We then got to wait for our which came out 45 minutes later. So, an hour and 15 minutes after being seated we got our food. I can't blame the server except for not letting us know what was going on.  I will blame the management because they were not visible. It was like the kitchen staff was all on break and suddenly came back and started sending food out. The burgers are anything but YUMM, overcooked and tasteless except for the toppings.  Finally, when asked for separate checks, we were told "you can do it on the robin" a table top kiosk. Of course, it didn't work. What did work was the kiosk recommending a 20% tip. Really? Do yourself a favor skip Red Robin and use a Carl's Jr. drive thru, the burgers taste better and you don't wait and hour for the food.
If you happen to actually get seated the food is ok but the service at this location needs some major improvement

Sitting here at curbside pick up, now for 24 minutes. Waiting patiently and have called twice, if I were appropriately dressed my ass would have walked in already. The poor woman next to me has an infant and finally walked in, she has yet to walk out with her food. Not to mention the homeless man just chilling in front begging for money. I realize they are busy but really. My cc is already charged.

Today we came to use a gift card we received from when this Roseville location totally messed up our order. We came on a Sunday at 5:10 hoping to get a table in less than 30 minutes because usually the wait is so long on all days of the week. We got a table within 5 minutes. 40 minutes later, At 5:50 we begged for some fries because our 9 year old was starving. They brought out his meal and some fries at 6:00pm, my husband and I didn't get our burgers until until 6:05pm.  We are starving so we won't taste the food and we will just inhale it. Maybe this is their tactic here at this location.

Despite what some other reviews say about Red Robin, I've never had a problem with service or the food. I mostly stick to the burgers and the yep, endless fries! I hate these fancy burger places serving grass fed this or that, and they skimp on the fries! Here the prices are reasonable and drinks and fries are refillable! This location near the Galleria Mall is my normal place I come when I'm in the mood.

I have always loved Red Robin, and now with their new menu I love it even more! We used to come here all the time when we lived in the area with my Husbands kids and now they have revised the menu and remodeled the location since the last time we came so it now looks very nice.  We came in at lunchtime around 11:30am so we were seated right away. Make sure to get there early if you're coming in on the weekend because there was a 20+ minute wait at 12:30pm when we left. I love how you can customize anything on their menu here and they always get it right. I usually get the Whiskey River BBQ Burger (sub Veggie Patty) but this time I decided on the Blue Ribbon Burger (sub Veggie Patty) with steak sauce, chipotle aioli, lettuce, blue cheese and onion straws on an onion bun. OMG it was SO GOOD. Much better than any burger I have had at one of the smaller "fast casual" burger chains. It had great flavor and was super unique and inventive. This is what I love about Red Robin! My Husband got their new Smoke and Pepper Burger which came with peppered bacon, sharp cheddar and peppered ketchup on a ciabatta bun. He was blown away with the peppered bacon and ketchup and was intent on devouring this amazing burger. Did I mention that all burgers come with unlimited fries which you can customize as well? Amazing! For around $10 a burger I think this isn't a bad value. We were stuffed when we left and remained so for the rest of the day. Service was quick and friendly and the restaurant was kept clean. I cannot say anything negative about this location because we have always had an enjoyable experience every time we come here with no complaints. We will definitely be coming back!

I was picking up a To go order and was given free fries while I waited. The hostess Amber was super nice and made the time fly by! I don't remember the name of the girl who brought me fries but she was nice too. Great front room staff!

For those with short attention span the moral here is check your to go orders before leaving the restaurant. Ordered dinner Friday night at 840. My wife repeated the order and had it repeated to her. Salad chicken strips and a burger protein style (no bun wrapped in lettuce) with bacon and avocado, onion and tomatoes. Arrived at 9 to pick it up waited and additional 10 minutes.  Got it home to fine a burger patty with bacon and avocado none of the other requests not even the dressing were as ordered.  920 called the restaurant to complain and were told they would fix it right away and to come back over. 2 mile drive so not so bad. Got back to restaurant the gent at the front desk immediately knew why i was there and called the manager. Several minutes later he arrived and repeated the order back to mess offering to make it again as apparently they hadn't started already as promised.  Cut to 945. Still waiting for food. The gentleman at the front desk chased the food down for me. Sadly it was still wrong but as I had a very hungry crew at home I could wait no longer and had to take it home as is. The whole journey cost me a hour of my life. Extremely disappointed that no one checked the order before handing it to me. Even more disappointed the manager had no urgency in fixing my order and never checked back to see if it was fixed. Where is the pride in food operations and the service of the restaurant.  Sorry red robin you lost me. I will have to find another place for late night grub as obviously customer service. Is not paramount to the operation considering I have to pay at a terminal and the staff can't be bothered to take my money anymore.  We will no longer be eating here.

Worst meal at any Red Robin I've ever been to .  What ever you do , do NOT order anything with chicken! It was microwaved and old and hardened and tough from being reheated .  I tried to eat it still because I was starved and later in the night I got sick from it .  Just like applebees, Red Robin used to be amazing and now it's just slipping .  Sad really.

One thing about Red Robin you can count on is consistency from location to location - that's a "chain" philosophy I suppose. I grew up with Red Robin as a Tavern on Lake Union in Seattle.  My dad's softball team would often meet there after their games.  Being a tavern - kids weren't allowed.  So imagine my surprise and excitement when this little old tavern from my hometown became a chain restaurant.   Good quality meats for burgers or sandwiches.  The "gimick" with the bottomless fries always cracks me up because I've never once asked for more.  I've enjoyed a number of burgers - always cooked the way I like with plenty of acoutraments.   Bloody Mary's are awesome as long as you ask your bartender to spice it up for you.  Sitting at the bar on game day is nice because there are TV's everywhere and you can hear them (sort of). PROS: - offering seating at bar can ensure a shorter wait time - free burger on your birthday if you sign up - nice variety of burger choices/combinations - decent appetizers - delish lemonade - nice wait staff CONS: - parking lot challenges (too many popular eateries close together) - I always forget to get my free birthday burger - bottomless fries are a gimmick IMO! I go back because I know what to expect and any place that gets 4 stars from me is good eats!

When I first walked in I was greeted right away, and was told the wait would be about 5 minutes for a group of 7 on a rainy Sunday night. I sat down in the lobby to wait and noticed they had black boards with chalk to color on, with some of the boards containing games on them, so I did what anyone would do and played tic-tac-toe with my boyfriend while waiting for seating, which I lost, twice. They came to tell us the table was ready, however, I was in a heated third round of tic-tac-toe, so the lady said I could bring jt to the table with me. I immediately asked for fries upon arriving to my table, which was a super legit round booth, and drinks as well. They brought the drinks quick, but I was waiting like a savage wolf for the fries, as I had not eatin all day yet. I was getting mad the fries weren't here, then BAM, dude comes in clutch with 3 baskets. Dope. Food was pretty bomb.

Wow! We had such a great experience here. First off we were pleasantly surprised that we got a table right away on a Friday night. Our waitress was amazing! She was so nice and on top of everything. She even brought two kids Mac n cheeses right off the bat for my youngest son (unlimited) and our fry basket and drinks never went empty. It's great Mac n Cheese and my kids were happy. I had the arugula burger with roasted tomatoes which was really tasty and juicy. My son had the bacon cheeseburger and he was really happy. We enjoyed some boneless chicken wings and they had great flavor. Great family restaurant and a great place if you are craving a nice juicy burger.

Red robin isn't that awesome to begin with, but i do enjoy their appetizers so on occasion we'll stop by for a quick beer and snack. This location however, is AWFUL. The staff is horrible and that's why I'm rating a one star. They're slow, forgetful, and not very friendly. For example, last time I visited this location, we sat at our table for 20 minutes before our waitress even greeted us and took our drink order. I wish I had gotten her name because she was the worst. No apology and it wasn't even busy so im not sure what the big hold up was. I think a manager must've noticed because he came over and apologized for the wait and made sure we got our order in and food as quickly as possible. We tipped the busser because he was doing ten times more work than that waitress. I make sure to avoid that location from now on.

You know when you're extremely excited to eat somewhere because you haven't eaten there in so long?? Well Red Robin is generally that for me (due to health and fitness and keeping the calories in check) Anyway, so let's first just say, this isn't about the food because the food is always delicious. This is about the service. I don't ever report on service but this time was exceptionally bad.  We started with one server then he went on break and had another. Fine, normal.  We put in our drink order and also ordered. A basket of fries to start of with. 25 minutes later nothing came and the replacement server didn't know about the fries order so placed it.  Then what appeared to be the manager brought us fries. But basically dropped then off and left. No offer for sauce or anything. Fine, she busy be busy. We looked at the fries, there were about 10 in the basket. Ok fine, whatever.  Basically I'm irritated to the point where I don't want to finish this review.  I'll probably come back since I like this place. But the service here ruined my day.  You know where you're irritated for being nice to people who doesn't care about you yet you're spending money at their establishment? That's me, here at Red Robin.

This will be our last visit to the Galleria Red Robin.  They no longer bring fries to the table before food arrives which is a deal breaker for families with hungry kids after basketball games.  So disappointing... Update: instead of bottomless fries they placed a gaming device on the table and charged us $1.99 to distract our starving kids.  Shame on you Red Robin!

I have never had a worse dinning experience in my life. I come to Red Robin all the time with friends and family and have never had anything bad to say until tonight. From the moment I sat down it was horrible, I needed an extra chair for my party and had asked a bus boy and as he asked our soon to be waitress named LINZEE(yes spelled like that), she yelled "absolutely not" while walking the other direction. I was automatically taken off guard from the beginning. After waiting 15 minutes for her to finally get around to us she took our drink orders, and began walking away as we were still speaking to her she made everyone in my group feel uncomfortable from the start. When we finally got our garlic fries there was nothing on them so I asked for the toppings on the side and she replied with "the kitchen is very busy I'm lucky I got fries" again as she was walking away. She brought the toppings 20 mins after we asked, not even needing it anymore. As most people know the fries are bottomless and we were constantly having to ask for a refill due to the fact that there are only 6 fries if your lucky in a basket and having to wait 20 minuets each time while enduring her unprofessional rude remarks. Whenever we asked her for something it was always an "I'll try" or something I couldn't understand as she walked away while speaking. I spoke to the manager at the end, and got a non-apologetic response claiming he would speak to her and that she might be having a bad day, I'm sorry but I have worked in the restaurant industry as well and always leave my attitude at the door. I would give zero stars if I could, so know my one star is only there so I can post this review. If you get seated with this waitress I'd reconsider your restaurant choice or request a different server.

This restaurant has been a part of the local community for well over 10 years. Over the years we have enjoyed the food there sometimes good sometimes not so good. One time we had a salad with the large staple that holds the cardboard box together delivered to us.  Tonight we went after a long and exhaustive day working in the yard to enjoy the endless fries but they never came.  The food was terrible starting with cold fries to the wrong order to our table.  Unless they have a makeover I will not go there again.

I really like this location they always have great service and I have been here many times and never had a bad experience  I deducted 1 star because there is never parking lol and also they don't let you have a   Basket of fries as an appetizer before your dinner anymore :( and they are a little slow on the fry refills

Tonight was my baby bro bday and he always chooses to have his dinner at Red Robin over everywhere else, all 3 of my brothers love the royal red Robin burger. Steven was our server and he rocked it !!! Was so attentive, friendly and over helpful for such a large party he made it a very special evening. Manager BK helped keep the fries and drinks flowing and even threw in an oreo shake to go for me because hey let's face it..... who doesn't like oreo shakes. Thanks you Steven and BK I know it's your job and I hope we didn't drive you nuts with so many requests, but you killed it ... till next time my friend !!!! Keep up the fantastic job!!!!

Pro: Our server was very good. She was friendly and checked on us often. Bar area décor was pretty cool. Greeted and seated quickly. Bottomless fries. Calorie list on the table. Con: Burgers seem smaller these days. I Thought the FIERY GHOST STYLE TAVERN DOUBLE looked good so I figured I would try it. Our waitress asked if I wanted to upgrade to the Big Ghost which had larger patties. Lucky I upgraded to the Big Ghost, because it wasn't that big. The regular version must be pretty small. My wife's burger was not very big either. The burgers were very tasty just small Price - based on the size of the burgers they were overpriced. Not too bad but not quite worth it. Summary - I have been to Red Robin's around the area and the burgers size is just smaller then I remember. Still a tasty place to eat so I will go 3.5 stars. In fairness had this been the first time to this restaurant I would probably give it four stars at least based on service and taste.

We went there tonight to try it out for the first time. That will definitely be the last. Planned on trying the chicken strips, but they were completely out of chicken. Ordered the grilled cheese sandwich with fries. The sandwich came out hard and cold. The fries were worst, cold and hard in the middle. I am not sure how you can mess up the easiest thing on the menu. After being seated it took a good 10 minutes at least to get our drinks. Don't waste your money at this place!

Over price bugars. .cold frys.. 30 min wait.. no one in the restaurant. .up charge on everything..  our lunch ... two burgers.. one soda.. one water for $39...wtf... will be going to Mels for better burgars... this is the third time I've gotten a bad meal at this location... Cant fix pissed off...

Worst customer service..called in for a pick up order. I had to wait 5 minutes..no biggy...then the lady gives me an attitude..no biggy..tells me the order will be ready in about 25-30 mins for two burgers..no biggy...once i arrive the hostesses all ignore me and helps others coming in..biggest bs roseville red robin. P.o.s !!

Food was good but the service sucked. The place only had like 5 tables with max 4 people at the tables. The waiter was to busy hanging out in the back doing god knows what then to care about his tables. Then he try's to bring us normal fries when we got sweet potato ones. Kid doesn't know what he is doing. No tip for you.

Food was okay and the customer service SUCKED!! It has been years since I've been to Red Robin and figured we'd give it try for a late lunch at 3PM. However, after today's experience at this location I will not be returning. Instead, I'll spend my money at another restaurant in the area. While placing our food order, I ordered a draft beer. Around 20 minutes later when our food arrived, I asked for the status on my beer. The server said that the beer glass had a crack and she had to get me another. Around 10 minutes later the beer was delivered. Although the menu showed that our meal came with bread no was delivered. Around 5 minutes later the server asked how things were and I mentioned there was no bread. She stated they were all out but would have the kitchen make some. After 20 minutes with no bread the manager comes over apologizes about there being no bread. She says the kitchen is making some and it will be delivered. Another 15 minutes pass without any bread and we are finished with our meal. In disgust we pay our bill at our table and leave the resturant without any acknowledgement from the server or manager ... or any bread!

Ask for campfire sauce with your bottomless steak fries! 'Tis magical! I knocked one star down for efficiency, or lack thereof.  It can get busy in there, but I think they should be able to keep up by now.  Waiting for our order was like waiting for the cows to come home!

I always love coming to Red Robin because the food is always good and the servers are always nice. Ive been coming here for a long time and i hope it doesnt change. Food: food is perfect and always comes as ordered just like i want it and i have never really had a mistake. Service: service is good and i mean sometimes you get a person thats just having a bad day but dont we all.  All in all the service and food is good here and i will keep coming back here with my family.

3.5 Yes, it's a chain, but I love their teriyaki burger w/ pineapple. They're trying to 'upscale' their menu on the first few pages. Reminded me a bit of Cheesecake factory, their updated menu. Several new 'gourmet' burgers on focaccia bread, with blue cheese, bacon, etc. Stick to what you do well. Middle of the road burgers that are well executed. Don't raise your prices to compete with the bigger chains. Your burgers are simple and tasty. The bottomless fries are a treat. Love the sweet potato fries. Crispy, tasty.  Cleanliness could improve a bit, but overall a really good burger. A bit expensive for $10+, but guess that's the average now. Guess I'm getting old, or cheap, or both. But, it does come with fries, so that's a good thing. Don't appreciate them nickel and diming if you want garlic fries or sweet potato fries (think it's $1.50 more). Oh well, it was worth it.  Simple, casual fare. Sometimes you just need a good burger, and Red Robin fits the bill.  Boo-- some Red Robins have a 'kids eat free' night of the week, but just called this location and they don't do that. Bring it back! :)

We came before busy dinner time on Monday around 4:30 and the service were super slow.  They have a unlimited fries but when my husband asked for another serving it took about 20 minutes before it came and we were already done eating.  What a disappointing service.  Our server name Natalie is okay but not excellent.  I wonder what took them so long to cook their fries.  I love RR but they need to improve their service.  Like slow or not still the same

My friend and I had lunch there like a month ago and we went back on Friday and the server remembered us! She even remembered what table we sat at! I thought it was really sweet! :) I ordered my usual lunch favorite, a wedge salad & side of fries. She rang up the fries as a "refill" for my friend's meal, brought us 2 refills (hot, fresh, and delicious, mmmmm) and I left happy & stuffed. I had lemon water, so my whole lunch was $3, lol. Best restaurant experience in a long time! :)

We've been here many times and enjoyed the food here, but our visit last night was the worst!  First of all, the wait for our table was long. About 35-40 minutes for our family of 6. But it seemed fairly busy so it was fine.  Once we were seated, our waiter took our drink and food orders. It took 15 minutes for our drinks and 45 minutes for the onion ring appetizer! We complained about the long wait to the manager, who brought out the onion rings, and so they hurried and brought all of our food out, only minutes after, before we even finished our appetizer. The onion rings before used to come out fairly quickly and piping hot! But last night, it too long to come out and both our appetizer and entrees came out at room temperature.  The manger apologized and took off the onion rings from our bill and offered a free doughnut tower, but we refused to accept their charity.  To all diners, please think twice before coming here with friends and family if you want a decent time.
AmaIng food! Amazing Service! Good Vibes the entire night! Couldn't have had a better experience here. Our server was EXCELLENT! Ask for Ashley! She'll take care of you! Perfect!

I usually never go to Red Robin but last week when I decided to go I was pleasantly surprised! Reena was my server, and needless to say she was absolutely fantastic! When I complimented her on her service she told me that she had only been working for Red Robin for two weeks and I was shocked! She did an awesome job, i made a yelp account to just to leave this review and will definitely be coming back!

It really must say something when you can work at a place for over a year and still LOVE the food! I worked at a Red Robin ( 10+) years ago while going to school. I lived off the food, loved it then and still love it. The Bonzai Burger is my go to, terriaki marinaded with a grilled pineapple, I love it. My hub loves the Mushroom burger. I feel like the fries are not as good as they used to be and my 4 year old hated the pasta and meatballs for kids. He likes 95% of the stuff you put in front of him. You win some you lose some. We had it togo so I haven't eaten at this location, but I love how they are all so similar. We will be back. P.S. BRING BACK THE POT ROAST BURGER... it was sooooo goooood, and soooo under appreciated.
Had a wonderful evening with the family and we owe it to our wonderful, awesome server, Jennifer. It was her fourth day on the job and she rocked it like a pro!!

What a great lunch!  My guest had one of the many to choose from burgers and I ordered a southwest salad .  The waitress brought out two baskets of hot fries to snack on that were fried to perfection before our plates arrived:). Our lunches were delicious and memorable and we will be return customers.

Had a weird experience. Went here with my boyfriend and we only ordered ordered chicken strips and frys plus some doughnut things to share for lunch. We were in a hurry. We waited awhile they brought out the frys and doughnuts and never brought out the chicken strips and then gave us our check that didn't have any chicken strips on them.. lol well we didn't have any more time to order them again and to wait again we had already waited awhile so we just payed for our frys and left. I guess frys and doughnuts is enough for lunch.

My fiancé and I like to come here occasionally when we're visiting his parents and want a decent burger. In the last year they've added a whole slew of items, including new tasty dips for their endless fries and GLUTEN FREE BUNS!!! I believe it's $1-2 to add the GF bun, but it's worth it. It's a dang good bun. Last time we came we had 6 people and got a nice big booth, but the wait was rather long.  And sorry, but "endless" fries to me, should mean as soon as my grubby fingers touch the last fry in the basket, another basket should be set down. They make it hard to be endless when you have to literally flag someone down to get more fries. Upside: favorite new dip is the Thai chili. Try it.  Service is usually awesome or not awesome. Vague, sure, but that's just how it is. The server is either wonderfully attendant or harder to find than a bathing suit in January. Recommendations: whichever burger has the fried egg on it, with endless fries, Thai chili dipping sauce, and cole slaw. Winner.

Service is good but the fries were soggy and cold won't be coming to this one again bad management and quality control. Can't wait to go McDonald's after this don't waste your time coming here go to Burger King or something like that.

The ROYAL BURGER... with bacon and sunny side up egg.  MONEY.  DELICIOUS.  ate it twice in a week with Sweet potato Fries and a beer.    SO GOOD.   They show sports at the bar.   Friendly servers but the first day, as soon as I was done,  was rushing me out the door.  Damn.  The next day, different server, she said, take your time.  So it made me think about the first server...  ???   There were empty seats around me.

Our server was very nice. She is new and didn't realize the fruit cup was frozen served thawed There were a lot of things that she needed to explain such as extra cost to have a little more sauce on the side. Also the fact that the specialty burgers are doubled the size of the regular burger it would've been nice to know that prior to ordering.
Excellent food menu selection, good service & good food.  Coupons sent via email if on the club

Today I came into Red Robin's for the first time, and I couldn't have asked for a better server than Meriah! She is so welcoming, friendly, and helpful. She was genuinely patient with our large group, kept our waters filled, and cracked a few jokes. I will DEFINITELY be coming back just to see Meriah. Meriah is the definition of customer service, one of the sweetest waiters I've met. :)
I hate when they forget the order then , Rush and do it  wrong !!!!  Just get it right !!!

Terrible service today. Served our appetizer with no plates and no ranch. Asked the girl for ranch says ok and never comes back. Entrees come we haven't touched our appetizers and I ask for a manager. The girl bringing the food says she is one and I tell her what's going on and all I get is an I'm sorry. Then sweet potato fries are cold and ask for more that are hot and that takes another ten fifteen minutes.  No discount and no real follow up. Sad to see and what a waste of fifty dollars. Won't be back!

I could see the staff there are happy but not attentive that they forget to give us some napkin, refill the water and have an empty ketchup bottle. We had to wave are hands like we just didn't care to flag down a hostess or a waitress for our simple request. But the staff always had a genuine smile and quick to grab what we requested. The food was alright. The atmosphere is loud. I prefer the Elk Grove location.

I've been coming to Red Robin for a while and I play it safe with the Chichen tenders with unlimited fries. Basically, I go there for the unlimited fries because everything else is just okay. Burgers are small and for the price not really worth it for me. I'd rather go eat a burger at In and out. Man...if In and out had unlimited fries it would be out of this world! Anyway, back to the review. The food is okay, the atmosphere is very nice, and the unlimited fries are awesome.

When I'm craving burgers, THIS is the spot that first comes to mind!  For all the years I've been here, I've ALWAYS gotten the Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger, so I can't speak for anything else but that burger! It is absolutely delicious when served right off the grill. They provide ample amount of produce in the burger that gives it that balance from all that meat! I love their bottomless steak fries that comes along with the burger meal with a dash of their Red Robin seasoning! Service is always excellent and food is served quick. I'd highly recommend pairing your sandwich with their strawberry lemonade!  Come hungry and you'll leave happy!

We didn't have to wait long to get a table but it was very crowded.  Unfortunately, we were stuck at a booth by the entrance to the service area and the kitchen but the booth was barely large enough to fit two people and the three of us were a bit cramped. I was practically hanging off the side of the seat.  This one busboy kept smacking me in the leg with dish bins and glass racks because he was carrying too many and not paying attention to where he was going.  A knife had fallen onto the floor by the kitchen door at some point and I wasn't going to say anything at first, but after seeing 7 people step on it and 4 more kick it around the floor, I was about to say something when someone else finally knocked it under the kitchen door. Not only was that a safety hazard, but these people weren't even paying attention to where they were walking. I really hope they threw that knife in the trash. About 10 minutes later a whole tray of knives fell on the floor and some people just stepped over them while others cleaned them up. I know it was busy, but you're seriously going to try and maneuver around people who are crouched down and handling cutlery?  We ordered an appetizer but it came out like a minute before our meals did so we mostly ate it afterwards (what's the point of calling it an appetizer if it comes out at the same time as the meal?) This happened the last time I was here too.  I had their "gourmet" Black&Bleu burger, which was good, but kind of small and a little pricey at $15. I didn't notice until after it arrived, but the waitress didn't ask me how I wanted it cooked. She didn't ask any of us for that matter. I think I'll stick to the Bleu Ribbon burger, which is my favorite.  I like the food here but the crowds and the occasionally inattentive staff sort of keep me away.

Today is worst service I have ever had in coming to this location in 14 years.  And, the "alleged" manager K was extreme rude and "too busy" to listen to the issues.  This is not good for this location.  What also is bad is I came here for my b day burger and chose this location out of 2 specifically because I had been do loyal to it. I am truly disappointed.

We went in at about 9pm on a Thursday. Our server was Priscilla. Is appeared that she was handling about 6 tables by herself and she seemed a little overwhelmed. Given that, she did a really good job handling our group of seven adults. We had six meals with bottomless fries and one bottomless root beer float. She gets five stars for sure!  Here is why I gave red robin two stars. The first batch of fries that came out tasted like they had been sitting for a while. They were very stale and not crispy anymore. We didn't say anything because we knew they would have to make fresh ones since there were 7 of us. I would like it if the fries came in more bulk especially since there were seven grown adults. The fries lasted about 30 seconds before we needed more. Unlike children, we knew when to cut ourselves off from them if we were getting full so none were wasted. I just seemed like a hassle for us and our server to keep bringing fries over and over in these little amounts.  What really set me off was the bathroom. The men's room looked like a war zone. The trash was overflowing and there were were multiple toilet seat covers jammed into the big stall. I attached pictures so you know I wasn't exaggerating. They have a sign on the door that says they try and keep it clean but there is no way an employee had stepped foot in there. The burgers were good so I will probably be back. Hopefully they are more well staffed and have all their housekeeping done.

I understand that when you go to a burger place and order fish that you may be somewhat disappointed.  Okay, so I was there and ordered the Alaskan cod fish and chips. Everything was good and then the food was served.  Hmm,  little torpedoes of batter dipped fish (?) and the regular steak fries. Four torpedoes of cod about 4-5 inches in length weighing in at about a lot. They were heavy!! So i took a bite and immediately my mouth was filled with the taste of old grease, not just a little old, but DAMN that crraps old grease. I scrapped the batter off of the cod and the fish wasn't much better. All in all it was terrible to say the least  Even the tarter sauce, lemon juice and pepper couldn't make it taste netter  Lesson learned: Don't order fish from a burger joint  Up and away to the nrxt one.

WE came here after a day on the lake. We had an hour and a half before we had somewhere to be. I told the host this and they seated us. (We were a party of 5) We has a waiter that I guess was in trouble because she came to our table after being seated for 20 minutes to tell us she was getting chewed out but in different words. Short story it took almost an hour to get our food, and all we ordered was a few burgers. It then took about 10 minutes to talk to a manager, but she did make it right.  We didn't get to finish our food, and it was a very disappointing dinner. I wouldn't come back.

Just ate lunch at this joint with my sister and mother. Our waitress Monique was too busy chatting with the guys in the back to be attentive to us.
