She brought out wrong drinks, then sat food on the table and left not asking if anything was needed. When we finally were able to ask her about getting something (some ranch) it took 5+ minutes to get the food. On top of it all her shirt was untucked and you could see her ass. On top of that my whiskey river chicken wrap tasted like the anus of a running ram. Solid joint, 10/10 would shit my brains out again.

The place was packed tonight, food was cold and I'm still giving this place a 5 star review!  The service was outstanding, they made up for the cold food and then some.  The manager (Steven) and our waitress (Alena) completely took care of us.   Thank you both!
Our waiter and staff are wonderful AND they will cook a hamburger medium-rare, delicious simple burger, will definitely be back. The ceaser salad is so good!

Went for lunch yesterday with a co worker. We got there as soon as it opened. Seated immediately obviously lol. Waitress was nice. Seems she was host and waitress so service was a little slower once in filled up. The customer service was good. The food did its job. The burger was good but it wasn't anything out of this world. My tastebuds are still aching for the sandwich spot. Nice restaurant. I loved all the decorations but I probably wouldn't choose to come back any time soon. So many great options in Roseville this one just doesn't have the edge on other restaurants. My coworker only wanted to come here because he had a free Bday burger.

This review is well overdue.  The service we received from Amy W. was superb! If only we could clone Amy as a host, we certainly would. We travel all over the place and hosts like Amy are very difficult to find.  Food and drinks were brought out in a timely manner and we didn't have to ask for anything. Just when we wanted more of something, Amy was right there with it.  If I was Amy's boss, I'd give her a raise! Thanks Amy for making our drive back from Reno more bearable over the labor day weekend!

Wait for table was 15 min. Wait for food: 30+ min. Loud restaurant. Glass was dirty. Waiter tried to sell me up before taking order. Refill with wrong drink. Waiting...again for check. Table had no napkins...couldn't ever find waitress. Nobody around us has their food. Finally leaving this hell hole. Food was good.

Whenever we are in the mood for some unlimited fries, we come to Red Robin! Depending on the day and how packed it is - we will sit either in the bar (happy hour!) or the restaurant. I'm always one who is looking for a great value - and for the most part you get it at Red Robin - especially if you are a Red Robin Loyalty member (free to sign up). You always get your 10th burger free (purchase 9 in any number of visits and the 10th's free), you get a free birthday burger, and at various times during the year you get deals loaded on, I can't tell you how many times I had a free $10 loaded on my card or a free milkshake, etc... Of course you MUST have your card with you and hand it to your server so they can swipe it to get your deal.  That being said - they are always really accomodating with specializing any burger, they have multiple options from a wheat bun to a kaiers roll to making it all protein and having a lettuce bun! I LOVE that they added new dipping sauces for their fries, and of course the all you can eat unlimited fries are great. Not to mention the prices really just are reasonable. When we sit at the bar, we get our usual hamburgers, my husband gets a beer and i get an iced tea and we are usually out of there for less than $35. AND usually I'm taking home my burger since I ate only fries! On top of this - they have some great happy hour appetizers - their wedge salad is absolutely delicious - if my husband and I want to throw some healthy into our dinner we'll get the wedge - for $3 during happy hour, you can't beat it :) I gave 4 out of 5 stars only because sometimes the service can be poor when there are a lot of people there, even sitting at the bar sometimes we don't get refills for a WHILE until we ask.

The food was great.  My young boys really enjoyed the unlimited side dish of tangerines.   The waitress put a lot of attention on our kids which they loved it.  The only negative thing I would have to say is if you want another basket of fries is to order it before you run out because there is a wait for them.  When I finished my first basket, I was hoping she would of asked me if I would like more.  Overall I was happy and I would come back

I go to this Red Robins quite a few times, and those few times service and food was very good.  When we came on 11/13/14, it was my husband, my brother, his boyfriend, and myself. The girls working that night seemed to be so unhappy about being there and having a job. They didn't greet us but instead looked at us like we were not supposed to be there. We were seated and got our orders put in for our drinks, our waitress wasn't friendly but she wasn't rude. She also seemed like she didn't want to be there. We put our orders in for our food and the waitress came by with only one basket of fries, but there are four of us at the table. Our food came and I really expected better than what I received. Carls Jr tasted better than what I received last night. I ordered the clucks and fries, my husband ordered the bleu cheese burger, my brother the avacado and bacon burger, and his boyfriend the clucks and shrimp. I was rather disappointed with Roseville's Red Robin last night, I don't think I would want to go back for awhile.

THEY HAD A ROUGH SERVICE TODAY.  This review covers my last few trips here. Up until today everything was pretty good. As far as chain restaurant food goes this store has done a good job.  Then came today's service.  Table was dirty with no silverware. Our waitress was nowhere to be found for 15 minutes. My appetizer of zucchini was not breaded, was overcooked, and super greasy. Sent it back. A fresh order came out a few minutes later and it was good BUT the batter had been used to batter the fish too. I could taste it.  That was very bad.  My Chicken Ensenada was overcooked and tough. Sigh.  I have eaten here many times so maybe this is an isolated incident. I will go back again and hope that the management has solved these issues.

We came to this location on Sat Feb 13th around 5-530pm. We decided to stop here beacuse we were craving burgers and the Red Robin where we live sucks. When I walked in I was completely surprised...Immediately the hostess acknowledged me, smiled, and helped me. ( I wish I remembered her name). We only had to wait about 10 mins.. The guy who sat us had awesome customer service as well! He let us know his name, our servers name, and told us if we needed anything to let him know. (Most places just toss your menus on the table and leave.)  Not too long after our server Oksana came. She was so awesome! She was ontop of everything, had a positive attitude, and just overall had awesome customer service! She had a smile on her face the whole time even when it got busy. When we started to walk out even other waiters told us to have a good night. I have worked in retail & the food business so I know what is like to give good customer service. Good customer service is very rare to come by now a days and the people here definitely know how to treat their customers! I had an awesome experience at this location and next time I am in town I will definitely stop here!

Our group of four 30 something adults was seated in what our waiter described as the kids section of the restaurant, much to her surprise. This location recently went through a remodel and the booth we were seated at was very cramped. We are not large people but felt like the table was very close when seated as if it was designed for children. When our chicken sandwiches and hamburgers had arrived we asked our server for a knife since no silverware or napkins were ever brough to our table. She said sure and left. She came by with napkins but didn't have a knife so we asked our waitress again since all of us were sitting there with our food waiting for a knife. We just sat there watching our food get cold waiting for way too long before someone at our table got up and went to the server station to find cutlery. The food was okay, the fries are delicious but my california chicken sandwich was just okay, it tasted previously frozen as I imagine it was.  If you have three kids this is the place to go. There were about six birthdays during the hour and a half it took to order, get and eat our meal. Everytime the waiters went to a table to sing we had to stop talking because we couldn't hear each other over their unfortunate song.

Fantasic burgers!  I had the prime chophouse last night and it was amazing. Super juicy and the mushrooms set off the burger.  Their are sauces for the  fries I like all the ones I've tried: sweet n spicy, campfire (favorite), and thai. I love how the feiea say warm and don't go cold when you're eating. I have seen the short stack of onion rings they are really short. I've had the spinach articoke dip and it was amazing.  There was quite a bit in the bowl I'm sure I could eat just that for a meal and be happy. With a bowl of fries, of course.

This place is ridiculous. Don't advertise bottomless fries if you aren't planning on serving me any. Don't try to charge me for a free birthday Burger. I would implore you all to go somewhere else, Red Robin  care about having great service. I had to ask for more fries five times before I got them, and they arrived when I was leaving! Why should I tip for service that didn't refill my drink and didn't bring me bottomless fries? And on top of that you want me to pay for my free birthday burger. What do you think you're doing Red Robin? You're ridiculous!

Red Robin is a great place! I always go here if I'm in the need of a cheap great tasting burger. I have been going here ever since I was a kid, so I even know a little bit about the kids menu!  I always order a burger, and it never disappoints. The fries are normally on point! I have also tasted other items on the menu, they are very good as well. On special occasions I order milkshakes, they are pretty pricy, but they are worth it! What a great shake! If your looking for a cheap good quality meal, be sure to stop by Red Robin!

I've been a big fan of Red Robin for over a decade. This is a place I visited at least once a week. The service and food was always excellent. At one point they removed my favorite item from the menu but after lobbying HQ for months, it finally got it put back on the menu. After the unfortunate fire the restaurant was closed for a while and remodeled before opening again.  I have no idea what happened. They blocked off the front entry from the lobby of the front of the store.  They put up wooden shutters, yes, wooden shutters. I've never heard of that before, and now I know why. Everything is closed off.  Once seated you had glass dividers between you and everyone else. I felt like I was in a cubicle.  The sound is weird and you feel closed off to everything including the staff but what happens next kind of explains why staff doesn't want to be around, on the floor.  What used to be a training site corporate used has turned into a sad place to eat.  The staff used to be so friendly and upbeat.  Now they seem like it's a chore to wait on customers. I think it probably has to do with some "new" policies put in place by some bean counter.  Everytime we ate there previously, we were always greeted as soon as we sat down. After ordering drinks we could get french fries before the food arrived.  That no longer exists.  When we asked for ranch dressing for the fries, it usually took 2 or 3 tries to get some to show up at the table.  Refills on drinks used to be automatic.  There never was a wait for refills before these apparant changes but again, we'd put our empty glasses at the edge of the table and either some busser would try and take them or we would wait 5-10 minutes before we saw someone who looked familiar who would refill our drinks. Something must have changed at the management or corporate level.  I was utterly shocked at how different this place was.  I was warned repeatedly by my friend beforehand that he experienced such bad service. I thought he was crazy or just too demanding but I'm a pretty easy going guy and a huge fan of RR but man, he was right. And  so disappointed.  This was my go to place. I went there for so many of my birthdays to celebrate with family and friends but I'll be sadly finding a new place to eat.  I'm really in shock as to why anyone would mess with such a good thing.  The TGI Fridays across the street went out of business twice in the past decade and I wouldn't be surprised at all if Red Robin is closed as well in the next year or so. They really went out of their way to change this place for the worse.

Yesterday my fiancé and I sat at the bar and we had Khasem (sorry if I spelt it wrong) he was AWESOME! He was quick, orders were correct (and amazing) he recommended sauces and sides (all recommendations were amazing), he refilled our drinks before we even realized we wanted more. He was friendly, had a nice clean appearance, and took great care of us. Highly recommend going to the bar and getting him - he knew what he was doing and he was good at it. Beyond impressed! He went above and beyond with our service.
Not much I can order here, being the vegetarian I am.  But the service is great, it's convenient and reasonably priced.  I love the bottomless fries.

I have always been a fan of Red Robin but I do not plan on coming back to this location. Our experience was pretty negative from the beginning. We were a small party and were told the wait was going to be 10-15 minutes. The whole time we were waiting the little girls who were hostesses were just hanging out. When one of us went up to politely ask how much longer the wait would be since it had been 25 minutes it was a major inconvenience to them. After that all we received from them was an alarming amount of attitude, I'm sure they are still under 18 but they do need to learn how to treat customers. A few minutes later one of them apparently called our name (I think her name was Kendra), it was extremely loud in there and she said it quietly. Since we did not hear her she said it much louder with SO MUCH attitude, we all looked at each other amazed. She continued the attitude while taking us to our table even when asked how her day was going. We waited about ten minutes for someone to approach us at our table. Natalie was our waitress and she was the saving grace of the whole night. Natalie was not supposed to be our waitress but she noticed us sitting without food or drinks and was more than happy to help. She was so friendly and helpful it really made up for the other girl.  When we left the hostesses screamed to have a good night and laughed with each other quietly. It felt oddly like high school. When all was said and done two out of the three from our party ended up sick at home throwing up.  Safe to say this was not quite the relaxing dinner with friends we hoped for.

We were here for a farewell dinner for my inlaws since they are about to move out of state permanently. We got here at 6 and had a 45 minute wait, which was fine. We checked at 45 minutes and were told another 30, on sure it's a busy Saturday and after another 30 we were told that at 6 we should have been advices of a 1 and a half to 2 and a half hour wait!!!! WHAT!!! Then we were offered 2 booths to split our party that were "close" which turned out to be far enough apart we wouldn't have been able to interact at all. We saw a large party leaving and asked if we could have their table after it was cleaned off they said "sure, it will be 10 minutes" this was more than 10 minutes ago and we still haven't gotten our food. During the walk back a waitress rudely exclaimed to my sister in law "excuse me" several times as she assisted my mother in law through the small space with her walker. I wish I'd caught her name...although we were there with 6 others this is the 2nd time my husband and I have have a bad experience at this location  Once we were finally seated things improved and our first waitress, Brayde was very sweet and I have nothing against her at all. She went on break or was off and Mikhaila (spelling?) took over and she was just as nice, very attentive and we wanted for nothing, I hope every waiter/waitress I encounter in the future at all eating establishments are like these two ladies. Nonetheless this review is a 1 star, and I will never go back to this location ever. I only hope when I go to the Citrus Heights location in the future nothing unpleasant happens.

My family and I decided to eat at Red Robin today Wednesday at 1pm. So when we get there the host immediately takes us to our table a party of five,saids our waiter will be right with us. So then the waiter "Travis" takes our drinks 1 coke 4 sprites takes about 10 mins to bring our drinks over, 10 mins later he takes our order gosh I wasn't too happy. My order the burn love jalapeño burger and fries had no flavor,it was plain. We asked him if we could get our fries while waiting he said yes but didn't bring the fries til after we had received our food. So I was telling my husband to just pay the bill . While he was doing that my daughter and I went the bathroom boy oh boy was it destroyed in there like a hurricane went by out of everything in there from toilet covers,toilet paper, in every stall. There was more on the floor than anything paper towels were on the ground, told the Gm about the bathroom said he will get to it and went back to standing by the bar!!! By far the most worst experience I've had at a restaurant and the waiter didn't leave the bill so we looked on the computer and we left cash on the table. Red Robin lost yet another customer. Last time I go here!!!!

I've been to Red Robin 4 times in the last 12 months (2x for my B-day burger) and EVERY TIME they overcook the burgers and we've had to send them back. I mean this is what these people cook all day you think they'd be able to do it right. The flavors are good, but they can't cook them right. Today we walked in and waited for almost 10 minutes before we got a waitress. We were sitting in the bar 5 feet from the empty bar and the bartender was cleaning glasses and totally ignored us. Nobody greeted us or anything. I said "What are we invisible?" This was not a good B-day experience this year, last year or the 2x in between. Totally ridiculous. I will still go back next year for my free burger though and hope it's better, but probably will still be the same.So frustrating & annoying.

We absolutely love coming here.  The servers are always helpful and fulfill our requests.  My infant son doesn't usually like to sit in high chairs and the high chairs in restaurants are usually uncomfortable and not cushy like the one at home so we usually request a booth.  Since Red Robin has large booths, they were more than willing to fulfill our request.  One star for being awesome. Our servers are usually pleasant and take great care especially when they see my boys.  They are quick to ask my boys what they want and they treat my boys as people and not as an annoyance like some restaurants.  I love that about them.  Another star for being great people. The food gets 2 stars because it's always awesome.  I've had everything from the burgers to the seafood to the salads, etc.  The never ending bottomless steak fries are definitely an added bonus.  A ton of food for such a great value.  This is useful in my large household of testosterone.  Since they eat me out of house and home on a daily basis, it's no wonder I try to frequent places like Red Robin where I can get the most for my money.  My boys and I always leave happy and food induced coma like nirvana. hehe. Overall, our experience at Red Robins is always great and the wait is always short even when they are busy (especially during game days).  We love the staff as they are friendly, outgoing and they don't show that they are stressed out even when they are.  We love you guys and will definitely come back for more.

First off, Server was very sweet. Seated quickly.  But all down hill from there.  Dirty tables, chairs, floors Old cold bacon Burger cheese was still cold Sweet potato fries never showed up Manager was wearing very inappropriate clothes Noise level was way beyond reasonable

We came in on a Monday evening into a nearly empty Red Robin. We were greeted and seated by Molly. She never asked if we wanted to sit in booths, so she simply put us in an uncomfortable area with a tiny table. After our server, Sam took our drink orders, we politely asked if we could sit right behind us which was roomier. He seemed slightly hesitant, but made the accomodations for us. A couple minutes later, we realized that Sam and Molly were talking about us over this simple "request." (If you're going to talk behind your customers' backs, try to be more subtle next time, and not stare directly at us where we can see you.)  The only time that we were checked on was at the end of our meal when our drinks and plates were empty. Overall, terrible customer service. Most of the servers just stood around instead of checking their tables.  Here's a tip: Work on your customer service.

So so . We live by the one on galleria. The bar menu is not impressive nor does it have good prices. The kids menu is good, and the shakes are really good. My son likes this place but I'd pass next time . The wine was not very good . The service was just okay . Some staff seemed out of touch .

Awesome Blue Cheese burger.  I included onion rings instead of fries.  A little too Crissy for my taste.  Service was good.  This restaurant offers check out electronically in the bar.  I like to be able to close the bill out at our convenience rather than waiting for the bill.

One of my favorite things about Red Robin, other than the burgers and onion rings, is that staff is obviously chosen for personality as well as serving skills. Roseville is no exception. Meagan was our server, and she was great! We'll have to come back soon for some more Poutin Fries!

The quality of food here is hardly ever the problem. Food is usually hot and fresh (when they get your order right). The service is really the main problem here at this location. I've eaten here at several different times of day. I have had maybe 2 or 3 servers in total out of the dozens of times I've been here who were attentive and paid attention. Majority of the servers don't bother to check if drink refills are needed. I recently had an issue where they messed up 1 of 5 dished that were ordered. The server took the dish to get the right one but then didn't come back. I waited about 20 minutes before going to ask someone when the dish was coming out. When the person who was not my server brought the burger it was barely warm. The person who brought it out didn't apologize and acted as if there was nothing wrong with the burger being 20min later than all of the other food I ordered. It's as if it had just been sitting there in the back for a while. I also had to go to the front of the restaurant because there weren't any employees in the dinning area. I honestly don't know where these employees go when paying customers should be attended to. I mean cmon...customers do tip and they usually can only do that when your around to serve. I also didn't appreciate the greeter in the front who tried very hard to convince us that it was going to be complicated to seat 5 people. It was as if she was trying to get us to go away. In all honesty I can't figure out why the service I get is usually so poor. I can't say it's because they are busy because sometimes the restaurant is not even half full or maybe it's not even half empty? Perhaps it's just the servers who are not very well trained or just doesn't care? Maybe the servers just have trouble taking care of more than 2 people at a table? In any case don't come expecting much in the way of service as your likely not going to get much of it.

I thought BLT meant Bacon Lettuce Tomato. At Red Robin it means bacon Lettuce Turkey.  I'm not amused.  The rest of the meal was ok.  The service was pretty good though.  Will return but not for a BLT.

Came here to celebrate another year of life.  -The waiter approached our table with out saying a word, placed our utensils in front of us. He continuously reached within an inch of my face not excusing himself and nearly bumping into my face to place the utensils down.  -there were 9 of us he only gave us 5 menus -his badge said Kirby but the receipt said Sean - horrible service

Exceptionally slow service.  15+ min for drink order, over an hour to receive food.  Visit was on a weeknight and they were busy but there was no wait to be seated, so I am not sure what the deal was.  When we did receive our food, it was disappointing.  Yes this is a chain restaurant, but I actually happen to like Red Robin and have been to many locations.  This was by far the worst one I have been to.

First and last time eating here. The restaurant was freezing. Fan was blowing right in me. I asked to be moved or the fan be turned down. Neither happened. The amount of fries they bring you is a joke. I know you and get more but I don't want to wait around forever I just want to eat my meal.  Burger was over done. I said med rare and there was no pink at all.  Took the waitress forever to bring my bill.  Mint Brownie Shake was okay but not good enough to make me come back.  I was excited and this was very disappointing.

Surprisingly, they have reaaally good hummus here!  As a gluten-free vegan, I order the hummus plate as my entree....it comes with a cup of hummus, cucumber and carrot wedges, and kettle chips for dipping.  Really good :)    Now I just wish they'd create an official gluten-free menu! The servers have to go and get a giant binder every time I have a question.  And why on earth doesn't this hamburger place who has, like, 20 different hamburgers, not have at least ONE that is gluten-free AND vegan?!  Their veggie burger currently has wheat in it :(    C'MON!!

I had a more pleasant time here than the Elk Grove location. Much cleaner and the layout is more appealing. Our server seemed new but he kept us happy. Had drinks ready for us. Overall it was better than what I experienced in the past with red robin. I will come back.

I have been coming to this location at least once a month for the last year and a half.  The service has always been fantastic, but I've just had my worst experience ever. Lunch break with some friends and we waited for over 45 minutes for our food.  Our waitress, Kayla, didn't check on us at all the entire time we waited and people who ordered after us had received their meals, eaten, and were on there way before we even got acknowledge by the manager.  I don't know what we did to piss Kayla off, but to ignore your patrons is just downright rude.  This was the first time I have ever not left a tip.  She provided no service therefore no tip is due. I will still go to this Red Robin because it has been a great location, aside from this occasion, but I will from now on ask to NOT be seated in Kayla's section.

I was just there, a birthday dinner. Lousy service, appetizers after the meal arrives? Cant find the waitress. Order on the game machine? Where is the personal service? If I order on a game machine why not just call my name and I come get my own food? Because, it would eliminate the tipping process. But having the customers half the work, NO! Bottomless fries were cold at a table of ten, all the fries COLD and spongy. The burgers were not prepared right as two orders were wrong. The birthday girl didn't eat because her order was wrong. I can get a $13 burger @ The Broderick downtown, and get a GOOD hamburger. Cold food, terrible service, and where's the manager? Oh he must be cooking, this place is horrible. Never ever again!!!

Oh, Dirty Bird, as I used to affectionately call you when I went there all the time for your onion strings and assorted burgers and salads.  What has happened to you?  You have completely lost your mojo. At this Roseville location especially.  I have even given you more than one chance to prove to me that you still have what it takes.  You were very late getting my meal to the table?  OK, at least it came eventually.  Got my order wrong?  Ooooh, one of the staff gets a free burger because of that wrong order!  At least the service was good, right?  Nope.  Not even close.  I was there last Friday before the rush hour with my offspring and husband.  We ordered, our server was the usual jovial RR type, and all seemed well.  Cut to the fact that we (the adults) never got our food.  The kids meals (which, let's be honest, are the easiest ones to prep seeing as they come from a fryer and a large vat of premade mac n cheese) arrived and the kids ate as we nursed our watered down margs.  The kids were long finished with their meals and still....no food for the adults.  And no real concern that our table was lacking adult meals.  When we asked the jovial RR server, he explained that the kitchen was just really busy (but come on jovial RR dude, we got seated right away and it wasn't peak dinner rush time, so, that).  He offered us some fries, finally, but we didn't want fries, we wanted our salads with the dressing on the side because healthy.  More time went by and still, no food.  We finally told jovial RR server to please bring us our check, and asked to have the manager bring it so that we could speak with them and explain why we were leaving unsatisfied.  Mind you, we are polite professionals so we weren't going to make a scene or get confrontational with the manager; we really just wanted someone to know what our experience was.  So the manager brought us our check and seemed annoyed that we were not happy to have waited so long for our food.  She came out defensive of the server (which, I get it, have your staff's back but at least please listen to the customer's concerns), offered our super late meals to go and a small discount (note discount - not comp) of our meals.  We were over it by then and politely declined the adult meals to go.  We ended up paying over $30 for corn dogs, mac n cheese, and two margaritas with a questionable amount of booze in them.  In sum, here's the deal - things happen and errors are made.  No biggie. Just apologize and make it right.   I don't expect white glove service at a place where they clap "Happy Happy Birthday" to you on your big day, but I would expect, especially for management that was trained by a corporation in how to respond to a complaint in the best way possible to ensure guest retention and satisfaction, that the situation would have been remedied accordingly.  That did not happen at all.  We will never eat there again.  And it won't matter to you, Dirty Bird,  because there will always be big groups and teenagers and families that need a loud place to eat, but we will not be among them.  There was love lost last Friday, Dirty Bird.  Love lost.
Here's to gluten-free!  Gluten free and vegan burgers... nice. Service is okay, always friendly. Kids love coming here.

This was my first time eating at the Roseville location. I am not impressed. The girl taking my order was very nice asked more than once to make sure she took my order correctly, however all of that was a waste because she royaly messed up the order.  I only go to Red Robin for the ranch and I mentioned I needed ranch a few times. I got zero. The girl at the counter even asked the girl picking up our food if we wanted ranch and she still forgot it! I Will never go back to this location. My garden burger was cold in the middle  (which the food wasn't even ready when she went to pick it up).

Melody was by far the most attentive server we' ve had in a long time. She was on top of everything, didn' t have to ask for one thing & by far surpassed my expectations. Served & trained, Mid. Managed at the Citrus Heights RR for over 10 yrs then a couple at Yuba City. You guys got a MIT here, keep up the great work. Hi Felicia!

This is our date night spot to go! Not my favorite food, but my boyfriend absolutely loves it and I can always find something on the menu I enjoy. They just remodeled and although the wait was long we were offered the cocktail area and seated ourselves. With the remodel it keeps the cocktail area pretty separate and we actually really liked it!  My boyfriend got his usual, whisky river bbq chicken wrap - but modified- sub crispy chicken with buzz sauce instead. He is very picky and definitely changes the item from what it started as. They used to mess it up each visit, but have gotten it right with all our most recent visits. It is so yummy and I highly recommend it! I got the prime chop house burger and it was so good and cooked perfectly. I don't like pink in my burgers and that usually means I end up with something on the dry side, but this was not the case. So juicy and tasty.  Beth was our server and she was great, very quick and excellent customer service! David was our bartender and he made our milkshake and strawberry margarita and they were both so delicious! Great staff!  We will be back for sure!

Always good. I've been coming here probably about once a month for the past year since it's so close to work and home, one of my go-to restaurants. I love trying the new things they offer, they always seem interesting and I love that they change it up a bit. Sometimes service can be slow but only when it's busy. Never have had a bad experience here

Let's start with the positives: Food was outstanding and delicious!  Our server (Brayde).. I believe that was the name  did a horrible job. We were surprised she didn't card me for an alcoholic drink. I'm 24 but she didn't know that. We got help from another server at least 3 times because our server was no where to be found and had forgotten things we asked for. She seemed to hate her job. Everyone else working there seemed to be on top of their game and the food was good so we will be back... hopefully we'll get a different server.

We had a working lunch here and had been seated in one of the very large booths - not really a booth.  Almost like a round table from Camelot, perfect to spread out papers and eat lunch.   Kirby was our waiter - he was EXCELLENT!  Funny, charming and very attentive.  The rest of the staff here was ON IT, totally dialed into the customer and I almost felt like this was the Nordstrom of Red Robin's!  It was that good!  Food was good. A couple of the ladies ordered salads and a burger.  I ordered the Ensanada Chicken platter - it was 2 chicken breast (really one but they butterflied it and cut it in half and claimed it was 2) with a side salad of basic lettuces.  It was perfect.  So go here for the fries (that I stole from one of the ladies) and the great customer service!

Terrible service! And food was so so. We used to dine here frequently but had not been back since the remodel. They put up all these walls and glass dividers it makes it feel really small and closed in. Plus they have some smart board ordering system you are supposed to order appetizers and to pay your bill. Therefore, limited personal contact with your server. We saw her only a couple of times because other servers brought out the food. We had to ask a couple for anything we wanted because we never saw the same person twice. Definitely will not be going back anytime soon.

My sister and I love red robin. We're here all the time. It's our go to spot. We love the food, the environment, everything. Their burgers are bomb and you can't beat bottomless fries. I suggest trying their sweet potato fries which are also bottomless. Their shakes are also amazing it mine and my sisters favorite sweet treat.  I guess my only gripe would be is that sometimes the servers take FOREVER to get around to you. But other than that I will continue to go here as long as their open.

Great atmosphere but their vegetarian burger is disgusting. I didn't even know what I was eating. Asked the server but he had no clues what is in it. The patty was dry and didn't have any flavor in it. Their customer service was alright. Didn't bring knives or forks to us, they were expecting us to eat with our hands. Love their endless fries though.

Sitting here waiting and waiting, it's been 20 minutes or more and still no bottomless fries, and I love how the waitress walks by continously and never looks in our direction, meanwhile the waitress at the table next to us (Josie) is giving awesome service, just my luck!
I was surprised.  They had gluten free offerings and the fries didn't bother me (no cross contamination).

Burgers aree good, but service is rough. I have been here a few times on the way home from Tahoe and the food is consistently good. However, one time I had a burger that was topped with an egg and I asked for it to be cooked over medium, and it came out twice not cooked as requested. Do they not understand what over medium is? Anyway, the manager spoke to me and apologized greatly and offered me anything to eat or drink (complimentary) while they fix my burger.  The service the first time that I went was pretty bad, they ignored us for the most part until you wave them down, but even then they would take their time to get to you. The other time that I ate here when they messed up my burger more than once they were at our table asking if we needed anything every 5-10 minutes. Seems like they accommodate those who have had issues more than those who haven't. Treat all customers with the same amount of service.

Stopped by RR last night found the burgers way overpriced for the amount of food you get.  Service was very good but $15 for a burger and still go away hungry isn't gonna cut it.  Too bad because we really used to like RR.

Came in for lunch at 130 pm. Service was very slow and the food took 25 mins to cook 3 burgers. Don't think I will be back to this location anytime soon. Wait staff was friendly and helpful. I felt back the kitchen didn't support him on this dining experience!

Ordered a martini on the rocks which came out poured in a martini glass. To her it was ordered on the rocks. Waitress brought it back in a tall water glass stiffed with ice, no olive and a fat black straw.....in 40 yrs I have never seen a martini served this way . Got the ck and were charged for a double martini with beefeater gin. Neither of what was ordered. Bartender need to go bk to school to learn how to make a martini. Food was great tho.

Stopped in for lunch today.  Restaurant was dirty especially the booths.  Multiple tables had not been cleaned which didn't do much for our appetite. People that had been seated after us had their food while we waited and waited. When the food did arrive it was cold. ..the fries were sloppy and few. We never were asked if we wanted anymore.  Service was on a scale of 1 to 10...a 3.  Will not return.

Located across from Roseville Galleria. Same parking lot with the Barnes and Noble and Best Buy.  Hosts are friendly and mostly attentive. Seating is mostly prompt and service can be a hit or miss.  Orders here have consisted mostly of burgers with fries. Endless steak fries.  Food comes in a reasonable time at the right temperature and a bit over seasoned or overly preserved. Burger is well sized. Bottomless fries are typically under impressing. A small basket of fries is offered and often a refill comes about 15 minutes later. Obviously to encourage one to focus more on consuming the meal and not fries. To summarize the burgers and meals, the amount of preservatives definitely don't settle with the digestion. Good: friendly and mostly in tune customer service. Bad: wait for endless fries and the amount of preservatives used (bathroom) Overall service can't minimize the quality of food offered. Two stars. Not likely coming back anytime soon.

Place looks much better after fire remodel.   Big selection of burgers.   Wife has gluten allergy and she is able to get a burger here with gluten free bun and they do their fri's in separate deep fryer so that they are gluten free also.  Had friendly girl Morgan greet us at the door and she made sure wife was able to get their gluten free menu.    Our waitress, Mariah,  was on top of it with drinks, never-ending fri's etc.  Smile every time she approached the table to check on us.  Comptfortable place to eat.  Fri's were awesome too BTW

In the last year the service and the quality of food have gone downhill drastically. Fries are constantly burned or cold when arrive. The burgers don't have what they say is on them, and its like pulling teeth to get someone to come back and give you a refill. The burgers are always burned around the edges now and none of their portions are consistent anymore. Someone needs to start training these employees with the level of graciousness ive come to expect. Oh! And after 3 years of being a faithful customer they now decide to charge for sweet potato fries in replacement for their regular fries. Yet the waitress we just had says they have always charged to do that. Sorry girlfriend, you're WRONG!

food is bland and the fried jalapenos on there appetizer fries were disgustingly rubbery and gross!!! made my husband sick as a dog last night. never coming back here again..folsom location is waaayy better
Great service, our waitress was so nice and checked in so many times to make sure we didn't need anything else, the food was amazing and didn't take forever to get. Will return soon and often!

I've been going here for years, I've never had a bad experience besides today, May 14th, 2015. I came in around 8:30pm and there was little problem with my royalty number so my free item, she told me it kept ringing up as one, then I showed her my email then was able to get it. Also, she kept cutting me off and leaving in the middle of what I was saying. I got no cherries in my Shirley temple kinda sad, how I was treated.  Finally, I get my food... the food is cold! I couldn't find her so I just started eating it........whatever I guess... Doesn't really ask me how everything was going, just brings my check half way thru, like hey can I get more to drink and more fries. IT TOOK 20 mins to get some fries... I was trying to make a big deal so I asked the guy to bring me more fries when I got my fries I waited 20 mins for... he got them to me in less than 2 mins... I complement him on that.  I had to ask someone to get me a box, and I specified what size and for drink togo, I didn't get what I wanted so I asked a server in the bar to get me what I wanted and he was so kind to help. Also, Jorge was the guy who was on the ball and being oh so thoughtful.  I tried not to be too upset, but I really am disappointed in the service this time :( Next time I have either Katherine(she's usually in the bar) or Jordan(I think thats his name) and Josie be my server. I enjoy when I get them as my server, they are always on top of it, Also they have a positive attitude, and always a smile on there face. They also work good in a clutch. They are my favorite servers. They won't make me feel forgotten.

Our server Meagan was phenomenal!! She went above and beyond with her service and made our experience so much better. She greeted us prompty with a smile and checked on us frequently to make sure everything was great. We were also celebrating my moms birthday so she brought us complimentary desert ! Thanks Meagan!!

Terrible expectations from manger and host staff, insensitive service.  Visited tonight with 4 kids and 4 adults (Tuesday 7/26).  Was quoted 15 minute wait and it was more than an hour before we were served.  Literally everyone that stepped through door for 45 minutes after we arrived was seated ahead of us.  When asked what the challenge was we were told "we can't predict when people will leave their seat."  They after nearly about an hour when table was finally ready manager had the nerve to say "are you ready now?"  For a restaurant that is supposed to cater to families looks like they have lost their way.
Amanda was awesome. She was bright, colorful, attentive. I hope everyone gets to experience her server skills. Her spirt made my girls birthday so great! Even with 3 kids in tow!

My family dined here on a Friday around 1 pm and the place was fairly busy. Restaurant was clean, food was great, but what really stood out to me was the service. The hostess opened the door for us and greeted us with a smile. The waitress was kind and was fantastic (I believe her name was Alena) and even brought my boys balloons at the end of the meal. I've dined at other locations and I was impressed with the staff at this one!

The food was great but the customer service sucked, they brung me the wrong food twice, and then when they brung the right food it was half ass as if they through something on it instead of re doing the whole thing lol the place was very loud, it will probably be years before I go and eat there again, I might just try their to go system in the future.

My first time at a Red Robin. Not a burger person, but I loved it! The pretzel bites are really good because the beer cheese they're served with is delicious. We even ordered more of the sauce for fries. My burger was one of the smaller pub-style ones with bacon and a sauce that had aioli sauce. Delicious! We went back to various Red Robins several times this month (we're on a month-long cross country road trip) and this first one was definitely the best.

11/30/15 Kalen SM was my server. I love the DGB burger; so no question what I would like. Always great, fresh ice tea. Love the single booths, makes coming in alone comfy; time to relax. Patrons Kalen was serving seem content, older couple across from me held hands across the table. A group of older teens at booth next to them; a young Mother; little girl about 4 in front of me. Something for everyone.  Kalen showed me how to pay at my table; because of my REWARDS card, I had a discount; by the time I got home there was another offer on line to me. 5 Stars for everyone!  See you soon.

My family and I went to eat dinner on 6/24/2016. The service was horrible, it took 15 mins to get a drink refill. Had to ask twice for my salad. All and all the worst service ever at this restaurant. I will prob. Go to the Citrus Heights one from now on.

After a long trip to the Galleria from Ceres and surviving the mass people my roommate and I stopped at Red Robin to eat. Our waitress Melody was absolutely amazing. She walked up to our table, had a big smile on her face and laughed at all of our corny jokes (a true sign of intellect) :)   She was adorable and was buzzing around from table to table handling business like a pro. I have never had a bad experience at any Red Robin and the food is always good. In this case it was Melody that made all the difference. She was attentive and made sure we always had plenty to drink and our fry baskets were full. She was a delight and we both agreed that we'd drive all the way back to have her as our waitress. If you are reading this make sure and ask for Melody. She is a pure delight, easy on the eyes and truly great at what she does. We will be back for sure. That's what I call service, I would have given more stars if there wasn't a limit.
The bottomless fries are great. The burgers are alright (it's no In-N-Out) Service is always really good and I return because of that.

Food was good when you eventually receive it! We went in for lunch Sat, Dec 17 and our waitress was awful. We saw her only once - to take our order and that was it! We actually had to get up and look for her to get drink refills. We had bad service once before, but this was insane.

Very bad. Long wait slow service and the red robin food tastes less good compared to like Years ago when me and my family used to dine. This chain went down hill and the waitress was not quick and now red robin charges you if you want fries out early ?

For a chain restaurant, they do pretty well.  Lots of food -- loved the endless basket of fries -- and priced reasonably.  Get there early though, by time we were ready to leave, it looked like a 20-30 minute wait for a table.  Close to where we were staying in Roseville.  I'll be back when visiting friends and family in Roseville.
I got my fancy burger and it tasted horrible. All I can taste is mayo. Was so hungry but couldn't eat it at all. I wish waitress was more attentive. 2 stars because onion rings were ok.

Bri took our order within 1 minute after we sat down!  The food is always good no matter which location we go to but the service here is the best over all the Red Robins we've been to, so far!  5 stars for sure.

Just so-so. Not good, not bad either. I had the tortilla soup, which was downright awful. It tasted old, it was cold, had about only 3 pieces of chicken total and basically a thick, tasteless mess. I ordered it because I had it last year at another Red Robin location and it was good!  My husband had a burger that he really liked. I should have had that:(  Waitress very nice but forgot our basket of fries that we ordered as a "starter" for the table. I saw other tables that walked in after us get theirs right away. We had to ask   for the ranch 2x (that she suggested would be good for the fries) the fries were really good (when we finally got them) fresh and hot too:)  No drink refills. Had to wait longer than comfortable for the check.  Won't be in a rush to go back.

Too bad they are trying to market themselves as a burger and beer Kong but still only carry big beer. Where is they real beer?  and I mean craft beer.  Service super slow. Burgers are ok but boring when you can't order a decent beer with them.

Wow, it was my wife's birthday and we decided to go here. The service was horrible, never once did our waiter (Phillip) ask us for refills for drinks, fries, etc...true disappointment. He brought our appetizer when the meal came at the same time. My son asked for a refill for his drink and it NEVER came. Just the night before, our good friends went here and they cancelled their meal and it took them over an hour to make it right...what's going on with you guys!!!

The burgers and service are still good, but their fries and associated policies have really taken a dive. No fries before the meal, small serving size, and slow to refill. Feels like a cost cutting scheme coming down from corporate. Disappointing when the fries were a big draw for us.

Becoming less of a fan!  during my visit on Tuesday 4/22 - I have never experienced such poor customer service. =( normally the environment is always up beat and lively and this time not so much. we waited for our food for over 20 minutes as we saw it was sitting at the counter by the cooks... finally our server brought our food out - it was cold. She returned 10 min later asking if we wanted more fries, and never returned with them, her next time around was just to drop the check off. Maybe it was an off day there, but it was not the kind of experience I expected..

Was sat and waited a little for drinks.  Server got 6 tables at once, wtf was the hostest thinking?  Got told they don't do fries before food anymore since some people were sending back food because they filled up on fried...can't blame them for changing that...some people can easily ruin it for everyone!  Food was sub par, cooked as requested but the food was on the cold side,  maybe like warm.  Fries were slow to come out after we got our food per the new rules.  Server was slammed, everything was rushed but slow...  So disappointed!  We used to love this place!

I'm a usual here. And I constantly order the unlimited fries that I pay for and get continue to bring one small basket of fries to my family of ... While the waiters just joke in the kitchen they should b attending to customers. Not while they expect a tip
Great service fast and always friendly.   Have gone here many times with work associates sometimes up to 20 people and they have always accommodated us with no problems.
Ask for Khasem Samaha as your server - excellent service, very professional and friendly. The good food and his attention made for an enjoyable dinner.

It all went down hill so fast!! They charged my card three times! They messed up our receipt amount. We went to Red Robin for the first time in years. The waiter was very nice and ensured that we would be able to separate our check. Long story short, the manager, I think his name was Steve had no patience w us. Didn't even try to help us. He treated us like we wanted to skip out on the bill. He knew that he over charged us when we went back with our receipts. He looked at my sister and said "oh...we figured it out, we over charged you." And he didn't even try to make things right. I will write corporate regarding this. They messed up our order and over charged us...and then Steve wanted to throw a gift card at us to get a future discount on sub par service and a free second helping of disrespectful crappy service. Thanks but no thanks. I will throw away the gift card to avoid being humiliated and disrespected.

If you're a burger person, this is the place!  Definitely expand your palate and try all of them, including the seasonal specials.  Bottomless fries are delicious with ranch! Many other choices for lunch/dinner if you're not a burger or sandwich person.

My girlfriend and I went to this location of Red Robin on Valentines Day and arrived at 5:40 pm that evening. They had a 20-30 minute wait, which is understandable. We put our names on the waiting list and walked around the parking lot. We came back at 6:20 pm and the host Austin informed us that their system "glitches" sometimes and doesn't send a text to us. He was nice about this error, and got us a table in about 5 minutes. We were seated near the bar area, and had a server named Rachael. She seemed annoyed to be serving us pretty much immediately and we ordered drinks. She came back with our drinks and we ordered our food. We got the appetizer and about 5 minutes later we got our entree, which isn't enough time to eat the food. I ordered a "Bacon Cheeseburger" but I wanted to add the bleu cheese crumbles on the burger. She never mentioned an increase for the change, but it was on the bill. I asked for no pink on the burger, it came dry in a bad way and definitely no pink. I ate the burger and wasn't pleased spending $12 for a burger I didn't enjoy. My girlfriend ordered the "Garden Burger" and she added avocado which wasn't informed again about the extra charge. The patty was dry also and the edges were dry and hardened and difficult to put the knife through the edges. The patty seemed like it was microwaved, not grilled as I would expect it to be. The food was definitely below par for paying $40 for 2 people to have one appetizer and two burgers. The service from the waitress was rushed (after 15 minutes she asked us if we were just taking a break or if we were done because we stopped eating for a minute to talk). She got the drink order wrong for my girlfriend, no grenadine in the drink, and it came with grenadine. The service was rude, inconsiderate, and she just seemed like she wanted her shift to end or wanted us to leave so she could move on to the next table. I don't understand why your restaurant is employing people like this, but I feel this is not appropriate for a restaurant that has increased the price of their burgers quite a bit in the last 10 years, but not increased the quality or the service. I will not be going to Red Robin anymore, and I loved it in the past. I don't normally leave this low reviews for anywhere, but I feel this is appropriate for this restaurant as they seemed to have made mistakes during my entire visit to their location.  Thank you for ruining my Valentine's day dinner with my girlfriend, appreciate it Red Robin!

You won't believe what was in the Chili....A finger nail!!!!"    It has taken me awhile to post my review for Red Robin because I was waiting to see how they would handle my customer survey.  This occurred in November 2014. One of the people in our party of 5 ordered a bowl of chili. While eating it he got a strange look on his face and pulled a ripped off finger nail out of his mouth. It was in the chili. They offered to get him something else which he declined. I received a phone call from the store manager in late November asking what had happened. I explained. He was shocked. He said that he would look into it and get back to me the following week. It has been over 2-1/2 months and I haven't heard anything from them.  The manager indicated that it could have happened at the plant that makes the chili mix for them or it could have happened in his restaurant. He would try to figure it out. I haven't heard anything from them. I chose not to review them to see what they would do. I imagine that the health department would have something to say about this.  My issue is their lack of concern. No follow up or call back.  Their service has bottomed out. I don't know where the problem is. The serving staff or the kitchen. The food takes forever. The endless fries aren't endless. Two half-baskets of fries for 8 isn't sufficient. Ten fries doesn't make a basket. It is necessary to re-order. When you ask for a specific sauce it doesn't show up. Beverages are refilled if you ask for more. Sometimes you have to ask twice. Their rule used to be that when the beverage gets below the logo on the glass it is to be refilled. We have gone to this restaurant since it first opened. We have become friends and continue to stay in touch with some of their servers. They have moved on. Getting a table at Red Robin used to be really difficult. When we eat as a family there are 9 of us. Now it's not all that difficult to get a table for 9.  It seems that their business has fallen off. Even with the reduction of patrons, it takes forever to get your food. Things happen. A finger nail in the food???? Whoever the finger nail belonged to had to have know that it ripped off. It was a thumb nail. Disgusting. Worse is the restaurants lack of customer service regarding the issue. Used to be our favorite place. Not any more. GinnyZ

Came here last week with my husband.  Food and drinks are good.  The reason I'm writing this review is because the service was absolutely incredible!   Our servers name was Eric and he was everything you could want when going out to eat.   He was attentive and went out of his way to get us everything we needed.  He did this all with a great attitude that seemed like he actually enjoyed his job.  We will definitely be coming back to this red robin to request him every time.    Do yourselves a favor and ask for Eric next time you eat at this red robin.

Despite my new found state of vegetarianism, my grandma wanted to go to Red Robin, so we went. It was my first time, and it definitely won't be my last. Noisy, but fun atmosphere.  Our server was out of this world - he understood my dilemma on eating meat and allowed me to order a bbq chicken ranch wrap, without the chicken, sub avocado. It was so delicious, omg, just wow. Can't wait to return!

We love the environment and the food.  Several months ago we went out to eat at the Robin with the kids.  The food was great as usual.  One small problem.  All of the waitresses had hair hanging down and we found hair in our meal.   I emailed corporate and received a call from the general manager within a day.  He listened to my complaint and was very reasonable.   This is one of our main joints to go in the Roseville area.  Always friendly and great food.

I can't get enough of this place. I start it off with a tour of onion rings and a XL blue moon followed by a basket of fries with extra red robin spices and ranch and top it with a whiskey river chicken BBQ burger. You can NEVER go wrong here. Even the chicken salad and clucks and fries is good. If you have someone who loves lemonade, take them here! They have all you can drink and the freckled lemonade is to die for. I always go here for my Bday and use the free Bday burger. Sign up for Red Robin royalty and keep the surprises coming :)

Usually I get their Whiskey River BBQ burger, but today I went with the chicken Whiskey River. It was rubbery and overcooked - I sent it back and they quickly replaced it. Unfortunately, the whole group was almost done eating and I was left with a strange feeling in my stomach the rest of the day. Steak fries are pretty tasty and bottomless, and normally I really like their beef burgers so this place gets 3 stars. However, be advised: stay away from the chicken.

Every time I come in there is nobody there to greet me. The server Kirby is by far the WORST employee and waiter  . He purposely knocked over my freckled lemonade on a white blouse didn't even say sorry.  Just looked at me as if it were my fault . Staff is very slow . Fries aren't as good as they used to be but the new burgers are good .

I keep having bad experiences with Red Robin.   This time I ordered the chicken pesto pasta with a cherry limeade.  The drink was delicious.  The pasta?  Not so much.  When it was brought to me, it looked uber tasty with curly noodles in bright green pesto, topped with grilled chicken, salsa, and 2 pieces of garlic bread.  I dug in, expecting the pesto sauce to taste as great as it looked.  Meh.  All I could taste were the raw tomatoes from the salsa on top.  Hardly any taste of the pesto sauce.  Disappointing.  I ate all of the chicken, my two pieces of garlic bread, and only about half of the pasta.  Such a shame because had it been good, I would have surely ate more of it.   I don't think I'll be going back to any Red Robin locations.  I think they should bring back their old entree menu with the southwestern pasta and chicken parmigiana.

I just went to dinner here for the first time! There was a guy that works here that had some gauges and holy god he was gorgeous! Does anyone know who this beautiful creature is? He looked like he may have been playing for my team! Let's hope! Food was great!

On 8/19/2016, we ate at this location twice in the same day.  Obviously our first visit went well with excellent service from Patrick. He ensured our meals were done to our satisfaction and we were visited every few minutes to see if we needed anything else.  The meals were just as pleasant as the service we received.  Later that same day we met up with friends from out of the area who wanted to go to dinner.  In view of our earlier visit we recommended this Red Robin.  Boy did we look like fools when our server, Travis at table 53, thought it was better to joke around with other waiters and waitresses than to attend to our table.  Aside from taking our order he was never seen again other than talking to the other staff.  Regardless of his poor service he was tipped 20%.  My plan was to explain although he was tipped 20% I was going to politely explain what he could have done better.  After waiting for 15 minutes and no sign of him we left.  I should mention because he never returned to our table we had to use the wireless pay at the table device to pay our bill. If I had not returned in the afternoon I would have rated this location at least 4 stars and maybe 5.
This certain location isn't my favorite as far as customer service but quality of food is definitely up to par.
Back again, the kids wanted to go here our visit was 7/11 right before we flew to Seattle. Good quality food and beverages as usual!

This Red Robin is the best one in the area! I come here all the time and I've gotten really great service every time. Even if I don't get helped right away they seem to make up for it and always take the time to address any issues and make them right. I've come here for my birthday for the past 3 years and they do such a great job I just keep coming back. They check in on their tables often and make sure your drinks are refilled as well as the bottomless fries! :) Great prices and lots of choices for everyone.

Yikes.  This place was such a disappointment.  We went for dinner after my daughter's game and the first thing we noticed when we walked in were the new wooden...what the hell are those things...barriers?!   Long gone are the games for the kiddos, but added are extra tables for a claustrophobic dining experience.  Our server was lazy, frazzled and actually said to us when we asked for a basket of fries before ordering our meal, "Sure, hopefully they come out before your food".  What???  We also witnessed the table full of teenage girls next to us and celebrating a birthday, treated like second class citizens.  Half the party got up after their meal to (I'm guessing) use the restroom and it was at that time that out nasty server decided to get her group of singers to come sing the birthday girl "Happy" Birthday.  When our server saw that the girl wasn't in her seat, she threw up her hands and made some outlandish statement about being inconvenienced and THEN (this is good) one of the food runners (Lord help me if this buffoon was a manager) walks over to the table to tell one of these paying customers that they're busy and have things to do.  ARE YOU KIDDING?!!! We had to get our own silverware, napkins and  watch this mess of place massacre a dinner rush due to incompetence and the staff's lack of desire to be at work.  Piss poor, if you ask me.  I won't even mention the food...I've spent enough time being annoyed about the new and improved Roseville Red Robin.  Ew.

Just got home from Red Robin. We had a gift card which is why we ate there. First the good news:  the burger was good....and the food was hot. Everything else...not so much. Horrible service. So painfully slow. The food came out quickly. Our waitress was just not there . No water, etc.  Crummy. The world famous fries tasted like plastic....they are clearly not real food. They were hot but didn't taste like potato.  Icky. We tried to pay and it took forever. Turns out their computer didn't work...and the manager had to help.  She got the computer to work and we were finally able to leave. I won't be back.  I will save my money and go to In and Out for real fries or 5 Guys or not have a burger.  Red Robin you have some work to do! Disappointing!

I've been frequenting Red Robin since the early 2000's. It WAS my favorite place to go with my kids...very family oriented. But now, I am very disenchanted with whole change in atmosphere!!! The whole "Gourmet" theme!! If I wanted smash burger, I'd go there!!!  Add to the mess it has caused with the retrofit, causing extended wait periods.  Oh, I used to love this place, but now..., at least Bucca is next door.  Hey Red Robin in Roseville, there is way too much competition in the area for you to change your format.  Goodbye.  "Now your just some restaurant that I used to know."

Red Robin used to be our absolute favorite place to eat. The food was good, the service was great and the atmosphere was fun. Then they did a remodel and we will not return. They are no longer family friendly and don't even provide kid menus without request. They will not give fries in advance and the service has been horrible lately.  We miss the old Red Robin!!

We were frequent customers to this red robin like similar ones  in other cities we visited in the past.  This red robin was not much different than those in the past but something happened they had a fire in the kitchen and remodeled to a less than friendly more BJ looking like.   This remodel with a changed of menu changed my perception completely and will never come back here -- they lost me as a customer and I have placed their rewards into my delete email rules. here is the list of events that altered my perception for this Red Robin I gave them plenty of chances but time after time it was a bad result. THE SERVICE  0/5  literally the worst service - long waits, cold food, no utensils...napkins? what are you serious... - Utensils  No utensils even asked before we got food still none so we literally sat in front of our food staring at it. We had to ask a 3rd time as they had the small brains to remember that we DON'T have our forks or knives.....maybe they thought we wanted medieval times style (not everything is hamburgers - I like the chicken ensenada) -Drinks after getting our table we sat for a long time (prepared ourselves to order everything asap)....and hoped they notice us...once they did and about 30 minutes later with only half restaurant filled we got our drinks....once I finished a soda I asked for re-fill.....another long wait then waitress came back I asked about my drink...they acted like I never asked before....although I put my empty glass right on the edge...25 minutes later got my drink figure we would get food soon....lol another 20 minutes we noticed many people wondering too. empty drink again...everytime it took 10-20 minutes to return with one....is this a new strategy on top of charging $3+ for it. -Pay by Computer kiosk similar to chilis but red robin MAKES YOU USE this ridiculous table display that makes kids just want to touch it....which charges you ridiculous costs for games you can get on your cellphone. Meals 3/5 This was very disappointing I used love their food...now i just hoped it came out warm...the wait is too much every time it took like much too long..they don't even offer fries to hold you over...pathetic -Kids meals way too expensive so small that even infants would stay hungry....drinks no longer part of the deal...overpriced.. -Adult meals Its like they took their old hamburgers put them in photoshop and re-sized them to 75% and gave you their "unlimited fries" (only come when you actually get your food) - it comes in some ring and holds about 8 fries....just 8... considering the service it took 25 minutes to get him and they were well on the way to cold fries.. seriously!   Costs 2/5  too expensive for shrunken meals and bad service. Soda is priced like well-drinks...even kids soda was overpriced.   I had three straight terrible dinners here (just to see if it was accidental)....and each time I felt I spent a full workday just to eat dinner...kids were tired...and what happened to TABLE SETTINGS with UTENSILS???? should i need to ask for it everytime.... so sad...my kids grew up coming in to see the red robin bird costume character made them feel so comfortable now they seemed to go away from that...into something else.... so long red robin!  You changed for the worse

Usually I have no problem with this particular RR. However, today a coworker and I went there for lunch. It was after the rush, 1:45 to be exact. It took almost 30 mins for a chicken salad and a chicken wrap. My chicken salad was supposed to come with focaccia bread on the side. Uh, nope. When I asked my waiter, he kinda gave me attitude. When a mgr came by, she said she was sorry, they had burned my bread and she had them make new. I declined the bread as I was almost done with my meal.  I didn't ask but they comped my meal which I thought was nice.  Bottom line, don't be in a hurry or hungry.

No stars. We waited an hour and never received our food. They were steady not busy at all. When we asked the waitress if it was going to be much longer she said she would go check on our food, she came back and said it shouldn't be much longer. I seriously doubt our order was even started. Next time I'm in Roseville I will not even consider red robin.

The food was good and we love the bottomless fries! They also give you a free birthday sundae here which i think is nice. The reason I'm deducting two stars is because when we arrived they told us it would be a 30 minute wait and we waited over 45 minutes. By the time we got seated we were starving! Honestly, the wait and service was really slow. However the food and waiter was great and overall we enjoyed it. I
Just one more fatless, tasteless burger. On the plus side the wait staff were very nice.  On the minus side.. Endless fries for the fatties that come with every burger.

Very tasty burgers! I love that you can substitute a veggie patty in any of the burgers, so you're not just stuck with one type of veggie burger. They also have sweet potato fries now which I loooove! It goes perfect with the chipotle dip, I also get a side of the ghost pepper sauce, it's not as hot as people say it is, it's got a little kick to it but it's more on the mild/medium spice. One thing I did notice is the menu prices seemed to have gone up a bit...other than that, love the place, great service, and tasty food! :)

Slow service and inattentive, even though it was slow. We usually go to Chilis's because they have the games like iPads that the kids can play - a friend said they had them here so my kids were excited to check it out. It took almost 20 minutes after we were seated before they activated a game for our kids to play. And then we were told that our server had to check with a manager to see if we could get a second game so they both could play. This is always a given at Chilis and usually they even ask when they see we have two kids. Another 20 minutes and our server finally comes back and says the manager said it was ok but we would have to pay another game fee of $1.99 for them to play. At Chilis they only charge $.99 and they never charge for a second game player. So now I have cranky kids and the food wasn't even good. My burger was over cooked (are they supposed to ask how you want it prepared? They didn't...) and my daughters corn dog bites were all over cooked. Will not likely be back.

Went to Red Robin on a Saturday around 4:30 We were greeted by a hostess by the name of "SHELBIE", very friendly and helpful. Seated within the quoted  time frame. Our server ERIC was very nice but not on the ball. I don't know if they didn't train him but SERVICE has a lot to do with the overall dining experience.  We had to ask for everything from silverware which we finally got from another person to drink re.fills. We had an appetizer which was fine then our burgers and fries arrived. Burgers were luke.warm which really surprised us. But the Fries were cold and my husband said he had one that hadn't been cooked all the way. So right away I got our servers attention  and asked for more fries so we could get some fresh hot fries with our burgers. He never brought them . After approximately 18 minutes  I stopped a food runner and mentioned it to him he said he would get them after about another 8 minutes or so my husband said just forget it I'm ready to go. Then our waiter walks by I stop him and ask for the fries. We finally get the fries and our ticket at the same time. Had to ask for refills on drinks too. It's supposed  to be relaxing  and enjoyable it was everything but. Shame on Red Robin. Luke warm burgers,,Cold Fries. This establishment used to be so good. Also the new seasoning in plastic bottle isn't as good as the original. Don't know if we will be back. I do know that 2 other tables also had issues with getting service from the same server to the point of saying Server...Waiter...Can we order now We expected to enjoy a Hot meal but that's not what we got. And don't order a kids meal. My Granddaughter got cold twirly pasta with mushy broccoli. The 2 stars are for the hostess SHELBIE. P.S.  And the kiosk  on the table. What a terrible idea

I've been in here so many times and I just can't get sick of it yet.  PROS: - Hawaiian Heartthrob smoothie  - Bleu Ribbon burger  - River BBQ burger  - Chicken Caprese burger - Onion tower - Salads CONS: - pasta - getting things to go because the fries get soggy SUPER fast - pretty darn dusty - some employees --- mainly the ones that work up front.  Just recently, the girl who takes names in front totally ignored the crap out of my boyfriend and I because she wanted to have a conversation with one of the girls in line, while there was a long line. Wow.... I wish I could kick her face. Damn rude!
Really slow service today.  Table next to us wasn't even bussed the whole time we where there.  Our drinks weren't refilled until the end of our meal.   Usually has great service but not today...

I am a huge fan of Red Robin in general, but this is by far my favorite restaurant location. I have been here numerous times and the host/hostess always opens the door for customers and greets them with a smile. For the most part I am seated fairly quickly. Even at its busiest it doesn't take too long to get a table. The staff turns over tables very efficiently. I can be a very picky eater, but the waiters/waitresses have always been polite and patient while taking my order. I also often split meals and the staff is kind enough to plate that meal separately for me and my guest making it much more convenient to share. The wait staff is also very attentive, frequently checking on the table for refills or to see if everything tastes alright.  The atmosphere is very casual and social. It is a great place to bring family, friends and children. They also offer takeout and are very quick to get your food to you while not compromising the quality of the food. All in all, I have never had an unpleasant experience at this Red Robin location. The prices and food quality are good and I always leave full and satisfied. They have the best fries I have ever had! While I have tried many items off of their menu a few of my favorites are: The Burnin' Love Burger, The California Chicken Sandwich and the Southwest Grilled Chicken Salad. The only negative thing I can say about this location is that the parking situation is awful. They share a lot with two neighboring restaurants and a shopping center which can make parking a complete nightmare, taking up to 15-20 minutes to find a spot.

Food was so-so. I ordered the Red Tavern pig out burger. I could have had the same bacon burger at Carl's Jr. The service was slow, although the waitress was very nice and friendly. The worst part was the unbussed tables, it just felt dirty. We will not be back again, unless we get a free birthday burger. If you want a good burger go to Krush Burger or the Pub in Whole Foods.

Blehh. GROSS. Dined here a couple of days ago, had the "clucks & shrimp". There was a HAIR in my food. I mean, literally IN the battered shrimp! I could pull the hair off the plate the shrimp is hanging onto it! Chicken tenders were fresh out of the freezer & burnt on the back. McDonald's chicken nuggets taste better. A few hours later had an upset stomach. Both my fiancé & I actually, & he had a chicken burger. Server was lucky I gave her I tip, our drinks went past E before she realized we needed a refill. Ordered a 2nd batch of fries, best thing on the plate, but by the time is came we were ready to leave. Not returning.

i love burgers, and the burger i ordered was more than i could handle. i was STUFFED! It was good though. and i Love the bottomless fries, i looove potatoes, they are my fave. I'd go back, but it's out of my area.

One of the smaller red robins I've been too. When for my birthday and got the FREE burger for your birthday offer! Food was great, cooked well and hot! Service was good and fast, especially with them being really busy. Got a bacon cheeseburger, it was so good! Made it just the way I asked and their freckled lemonade is to die for! I had like four of them! Soo good! =]
The service is fast and friendly. The happy hour pricing is great.  Here are the happy hour times: 3-6pm & 8pm-Close Monday - Friday
