The food - burgers particularly - are very good and fresh.  My wife and I ate at RR a lot years back - sadly this trip did not live up to the memory.  Portions smaller, shake smaller and particularly on this trip service was absent minded, and was a Wed night so not real busy.  Brought the wrong drink two times!  Never offered more fry's either so I did find the "bottom."  Get the food to go might be the better experience.

Who would have thought Red Robin had some spicy in them. My girlfriend and I just  stopped in for my birthday. Nothing beats burgers and beer and they had some new burgers. They have a burger with ghost pepper sauce. Yeah, ghost pepper sauce, the hottest pepper in the world. They just jumped right over habbanero and went straight to the top. Yeah it was hot and just what I needed. I was shocked that a place like Red Robin would have something spicy. I hope reviews are good because I would order that again. Service was awesome like always.

The service was perfectly fine, food was good, but the atmosphere was like being at Chuck E. Cheese. I'm aware that when you go to a family restaurant that you will more than likely have to deal with kids, but this was ridiculous. There wasn't a birthday party or any other such event, just a LOT of families with a lot of kids that no one was watching. We watched one child, about 5, play around in her chair, drink in hand, & parents said nothing. This kid then fell backwards off the chair, spilling her drink all over the floor. The parents STILL did nothing until a couple servers came over to help the kid up. Really?! No one bothered cleaning up the spilled drink so it was walked through & tracked all about the floor. Another table had a two year old screaming (& I mean high-pitched screams) at the top of her lungs for the entire meal. When my husband & I walked out, the silence was deafening after all the noise. I know its not the fault of the restaurant that some parents are idiots who shouldn't have had children if they didn't intend to watch them, but if next time I want to eat in such an atmosphere, I'll go to Chuck E. Cheese. PS - I have a kid & 2 psycho dogs, so I'm no stranger to noise & obnoxious behavior. But this place was just ridiculous.
I was so SICK afterwards!!!!! I will never eat there again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  The SERVICE was good but the quality of food was POOR!!!!!!!!!!

I love this place! You get great food and endless fries or fruit or whatever you like! I've had better service at times but for the most part the servers are friendly and very nice! Great for groups. They also remodeled and it looks great!

I love this place! Their fries and freckled lemonade are SO GOOD. The only *small* thing that I dislike is that when you ask for a basket of fries, they give you maybe 6 fries in it if you're lucky. THANKFULLY they are bottomless. :) I keep coming back because for the most part, the service is great. The food is always delicious and comes out extremely fast.
Always great service. I love the food here and its always a great choice to come here. Also, the rootbeer floats are bottomless!

The food is excellent.. Whiskey BBQ Burger w/ bottomless fries.. w/ Campfire & BBQ sauce. But, I've gotten cold food; no mustard twice, after asking for it, two different visits; not that great of customer service, in which the manager had to come over. ..(same one, in two visits, within a week & half, both times). ..
Bottomless fries and rootbeer  floats? I think yes. Their service is also really good as well as their burgers

Fastest service I've gotten from red robin!  After a long day of shopping my girlfriends and I headed over to red robin for some burgers. We must've looked like some hungry vultures because the minute our server took one look at us. He brought out some bottomless fries for us to munch on while we waited- even before we ordered! Such great customer service! He was even considerate enough to ask if we wanted to split the tab :) after placing our order he quoted the wait time to be 20 minutes but our food came out in 5 minutes. The service here is really great! But the only reason why Im not giving it a 5 stars is because the flavor of the food just wasn't all there. I've definitely had better tasting red robin.but this location by far is the only one with great service

Giving one star for the terrible customer service I received. I was seated promptly but waited 20 minutes for my server to come who asked for our drink order and forgot the lemon wedges we asked for. 15 minutes later she brought them. I asked for a basket of fries before out order those also weren't brought out until after I was done eating. The server had help and still couldn't keep it straight. The table next to me also had to ask multiple times for items she forgot. Don't even get me started on the temperature. It was 86 outside probably 40 inside. This place needs some serious work on their customer service all the negative reviews are true.
Upon coming on week-night, we had no wait, and VERY attentive server who brought us as many fries as we needed. Also refilled out drinks without question. Will be back!

The food is standard for an American burger place, but overpriced for what you get. It's always packed. They also have arcade games all over, which are the bane of my existence with small children. Parents of toddlers, I know you know what I'm talking about.

It's tough eating at a hamburger restaurant when you're a pescatarian; you don't have a lot of options.  However, I tied their Garden Burger last weekend.  It's not too bad.  At least they have a garden burger or Boca burger option for all their sandwiches.  I also upgraded my fries to Mac & Cheese, that was yummy.  Chocolate milkshake was yummy too, enough for my fiance and I to split it.  We'll be back.

Dropped in for a quick bite while visiting from Maui. We had the mini pretzel appetizers, red white and bleu salad as well as the a sandwich and mini Bibb salad. All were good. The chicken in the salad tasted of being frozen and rubbery. The dressing wasn't to my liking (honey mustard). All in all, a pleasant experience

I don't usually review chain restaurants, but had to give a shout out to Red Robin because they are a great restaurant to go to for people with food allergies. My 1 year old son has a severe peanut allergy so going out to eat is always a scary experience for us. A friend who has a child with the same allergy recommended Red Robin. After we were seated, we told the waitress about our son's allergy. She told us about a separate menu she would bring out. A few minutes later, the manager brought the menu and explained their procedures for making the food (she would watch the cook prepare it and use clean pans, utensils, etc.). The food was later brought out by the manager and our little guy did fine, no reactions to the food.  Will definitely be a place we go to in the future with our son! One last thing: Parking for this particular one is brutal, and it can get very busy since it is across from the Galleria. If you really want to eat at a Red Robin, but don't want to mess with parking and a wait on a busy night, I recommend driving another 10 minutes to Lincoln and going to the Red Robin there. Much quieter.
this place is awesome. kirby and jared are the ones to go to. we eat here all the time and travel now 30 min just to get our fix hahaha.

We came here on 7/7 after the lunch rush.  Around 2pm or so.  When we got there we waited a few minutes because nobody was at the hostess desk.  It was not busy in there either.  When the hostess came up my fiance teased her & said "We were getting ready to leave, we've been here for 20 minutes."  She replied "No you haven't" & he said "Ok 5." & she then said "I'm only one person."   He let her know that he was just teasing her, but I still didn't appreciate her last comment.  It wasn't even busy in there & even if she was kinda busy in back she didn't have to say that.   Other than that, our server was really cool & of course our food was good.

Came to the Roseville location the other night for dinner with friends. I thought all the associates there we're really nice and fun! The guy filling balloons at the front with the big glasses was really funny and even let us 30 year olds get balloons hahaha!  My favorite is the Whiskey River BBQ burger, but this time I opted for the Bonzai Burger with the turkey patty (I almost always substitute for the turkey patty I don't know why but it's so good there!)  Everyone's burgers were great and my bff even liked their salad.  Oh and it was awesome because it seemed to be EVERYONES birthday I swear I heard the birthday song 10 times, Red Robin seems to be the new TGIFridays haha

Two stars for the service and the so so food. Went in on a saturday and was sat right away but our server didnt come by for ten minutes didnt even introduce himself(colten) and wasnt personable with us at all didnt even check  back to see how everything turned out and forgot to refill my moms sweet fries too until after she asked him where they were and had a "oops" looking face when she reminded him. I know its a traing place for employees there but thats no excuse for unforgettable service , they should be trained on interacting with their guests and more attentiveness no matter how busy they are. Honestly if you want a better quality burger and more enlightening service The Counter Burger  is the place to be, maybe a little pricier but the quality is more fresh and the patties are a lot thicker and they have awesome sweet potato fries! .

Oh what a day my co-worker and I had - we were melting in the hot Sacramento Valley heat and Red Robin was our saviour. I enjoyed a mini cheese sticks order, a rootbeer that went down easy, and a turkey burger that was dynomite! There was a note on the door that this was a training facility which i thought was odd but the service was warm with a friendly smile, and delicious and tasty food.

I came in yesterday with a large group and was very disappointed in my experience there. I had family come from out of country and I was excited to have them try it, specially the "bottomless fries." However, with the service we got I was embarrassed to say I even recommended it. We first got there and got sat, it took about 10 minutes for us to be even greeted by our server. At that time we were ready to order. Our drinks came out 15 minutes later (not even water was brought out) so here we are sitting at an empty table, thirsty and getting hungry. I had ordered my fave, the Freckled Lemonade.. I had to ask another server to refill it because my server never did. I asked my server 3 times to bring me another lemonade before she finally brought me one. Our food order took about 30 minutes to come, which at this point I was already agitated because we were hungry and the service was making me upset. Once we got our food, I saw that Red Robin changed the presentation of the food and now have the fries in this circular metal holder. One of them came with 5 French fries... 5!!! My cousin didn't mind because it's supposed to be bottomless so we all ordered another round of fries and waited.... And waited.... Asked again (at this point I kept time)... And waited.. And waited.. And asked again. Which our server replied, "it should be on its way." Yeah it should have been out 10 minutes ago. Watched as the tables around us received their fries. Everyone had FINISHED eating their meals before our fries came out, which took about 25 minutes to come out. There "bottomless fries" were a joke. At that point I was embarrassed. I like my fries with my burger. Not as a dessert.  The entire experience was pretty bad. I don't think I'll go back, which is a bummer cause I really like the Blue Ribbon Burger. But the service was horrible and the quality has gone down. The reason we go there are for the bottomless fries... But they didn't deliver, we saw the bottom.

Dinner Night #2 with my friend Drew was held here. The place was nice, a bit classy...typical Roseville. I had a hankering for burgers that week, so I insisted we hit up a burger joint. We landed on this one. I ordered a Sauteed 'Shroom because I have a weakness for mushrooms in my burger. For $10, that burger was so-so. Kinda dry. I ate half and brought the rest home with me. Their Platinum Patron Margarita for $9 was pretty strong, so I was a happy camper drinks-wise. The servers were accommodating and friendly, and even when my friend and I stayed for 2 hours until closing, they didn't make us feel like we had to rush out.

Best chicken burgers in town! The fries are the large steak fry type and you can eat as much as you want..yum!!  Also, some of the best Tortilla soup that I have ever had. Desserts are sweet too! (no pun) What I like most about this place, other then the fresh tasty food, is that the service is ALWAYS quick and friendly. They always seem to have plenty of staff and I am seated, served and have my check brought in a fairly quick amount of time. I always like that!!
Great place if you want a burger. Thier Cali Chicken Sandwish is to die for. Slap some mustard and Tobasco sause on and your go to go. Ask for x-tra crispy onion rings, yum!

Food was fine but the service is better at a Jack In The Box.  I live nearby and sometimes just want a peppercorn burger. Recently Feb 16th I just had to have one. Lunch crowd on a Sunday is busy to be sure but I knew that before entering. Actually our wait was not too bad and we were seated in about 20 min. The girl that seated us was pleasant and smiling. Our waitress came over after about 5 minutes and took our drink order (tea) and since we knew what we wanted we ordered then. After about 5 minutes my tea got there and I went to put some sweetener in it and there wasn't any on the table. The server was gone as fast as her legs could carry her so I thought I'll just wait till she gets back. After a good five minutes my wife noted that the table behind me left and they had some sweetener so I got up and got a couple packets. Still no server. Another 10 minutes no food our drinks are empty so I put our glasses at the edge of the table. Still no server. Finally I flag down someone (not our server) and have them refill our drinks. Meanwhile numerous employees including what I think was the manager walked by but no one could even see the empty glasses at  the edge of the table. Our food arrives and it is carried out by two girls not our server and set down. In fact our server comes back near the end of the meal and hands us a check. I asked her for another refill on the drinks and some of the never ending fries. She looks VERY put out refills my tea and says politely that she will get them as soon as they are ready. Last time we see her. So... after about 15 minutes (no fries) we leave and left her 1.86 tip (I didn't have change or it would have been zero).  If there is a server reading this I ALWAYS tip 20% even is service is remotely descent. I know it is tough and hard work. Many times with good service and a smile I do 25%. But, if you act like you want to be somewhere else or ARE somewhere else I feel slighted to give you anything. Your employer gives you more than your worth already.
The food is great,  there is usually a wait,  you can take a date,  and you'll be a saint. Good hamburgers.

So a friend and I cruised down on our break to get a quick bite to eat. We were seated fairly fast but oh man-our waiter. OUR WAITER... he just looked extremely pissed to see us. He stared at us and continued to hurriedly take our orders. He even forgot to give us a second set of silverware until I flagged down another server. When our food came (I ordered a chicken pesto sandwich which is pretty good by the way!) he slammed it on our table and speed walked out of sight. What in the hell? We paid and left him a tiny tip (HA! That's what you get for being rude!)  3/5 because the food is good, but wow..that server really sucked. He needs to remove the stick up his arse ASAP.

Went there Sunday for a Father's Day dinner. Was there about 4:15 and waited about 10/15 minutes for a table. The hostess was extremely busy and all alone which was strange but she still found time to chat with us and answered my questions about the remodel. Our server was friendly and also very busy but not once lagged on service. She got everything we needed and more. Manager made her rounds to the tables which I thought was great. Overall great dinning experience and we will definitely be returning for the yummy fries and excellent service.

Love this place, I can't even count how many whiskey river bbq chicken wraps I have had the past couple years... It is all I get, I can never bring myself to order anything else... Not a good place to get to go... Soggy fast... Minus one star because its just SO LOUD and service can be so so, booze is a rip off and sometimes food isnt always prepared the same way... They have bottomless fries that usually come out scalding hot, all 5 of them... It so annoying to have bottomless fires but they bring you no more than 10...  But I seriously have an addiction to that wrap.
ehhh our server sucked. but it seems like a delish place. very different than most which is awesome having veriaty.

The good: bottomless steak fries The bad: Weak margaritas The ugly:  If you order another round of "bottomless" french fries be sure you don't have the crappy waitress that we had that never brought them to us.

Well I usually have great experiences at this place but today wasn't that great, I tried something different the bruschetta chicken sandwich. I told them no balsamic *makes me sick* well sure enough our order took a lot longer than normal and it came out smothered in balsamic dressing. Our waiter never came to check on us besides to give us our bill. I like red robin but someone needs to train server Nick again.

The burgers at red Robin are simply amazing. Their juicy charbroiled meat is of the highest quality. The buns are fantastic and not soggy. They pile on the fresh cheese and produce and it's cooked to perfection. In addition to the mouthwatering charbroiled cheeseburgers they have bottomless steak fries that are to die for. their seasoned just right with their own special seasoning and you can eat as many as you like. For large appetites and quality taste red Robin is the only place for a dynamite cheeseburger

We went here After seeing the commercials and it looking so good. Unfortunately it was horrible. Ordered a bacon burger, the bacon was not cooked, pink rubbery bacon. The meat was comparable to a school cafeteria Burger. No seasoning, dry and crumbly. Barely any of the mustard I requested instead of mayo. The bun was mediocre, wish they put more thought and effort into that. I don't think we will be back and we have been fans of RR for years. The quality is steadily going downhill. Its too bad

Never been a huge fan of this place, but unfortunately, when we go out to eat with my mom, this is one of her favorites...due to a sandwich that she loves there. I would rather go just about anywhere else but here.  The one thing that Red Robin has been known for is their bottomless french fries, and the fact that you can get a basket of french fries before your meal arrives.  They have gotten a bit cheap in the french fry department.  If they bring you out fries before dinner arrives, they bring you out a basket that is maybe a quarter filled with fries.  3 of us shared a basket, and seriously there were 10 french fries in that basket.  Then when they bring out dinner, they no longer bring you french fries in a basket, they bring french fries in a cup.  Again, very few fries  You have to keep waiting for them to bring you more fries, and when you like them extra crunchy like my husband and I do it is a bit inconvenient.  He finished his burger before his next batch of fries arrived.  I always maintain you don't mess with what you're known for! My salad was lame, but not surprising...should've stuck with clucks and fries or a burger.

Food was great and our server Eric was fantastic! They did run out of sweet potato fries which was a bummer but this Red Robin was way better than others I have been to. Even the wait was not bad and we had a party of 7.

I am a rewards card member and I am disappointed with their brews" selection here at the galleria location. They advertise themselves as burgers and brews but are seriously lacking in the beers department. It's either an hoppy IPA or a coffee tasting dark brown with no flavors in between. No ambers, no lighter browns, like a Newcastle, and I believe they are missing a mainstream target market. We decided on going to the Yard House restaurant instead. There are too many options in Roseville to settle for this terrible selection of microbrews...Sadly disappointed.

If there is one thing that I really like about Red Robin it is the fact that it is consistent: consistently good. I have been coming to red robin since it first opened this location about 13 years ago (?) and I still order the same thing that I ordered the first time I came: crispy chicken burger and a side salad with ranch dressing. I don't come here often, by any means, however, when I do come once every few months, my regular order always tastes the same: hot, crunchy chicken with all the produce on a soft bun with a side of hot steak fries. The only thing that has changed is the side salad. It is still pretty good, but it was better when it was topped with cheese and tortilla strips. The service here is actually really friendly, maybe overly friendly, seeing as when I came here with my sister last night we were told by 5 different people on the way out to "have a wonderful evening!" All in all, Red Robin is a good place to come to get a tasty meal that tastes the same each time you order it.

I thought I wrote a review before...But oh well. Anyway I think this is one of the best Red robins around. We have been here too many times to count and the service from (about 3 different) waiters has always been fantastic. We have never had a problem with that. The food is usually good. Only once was my veggie burger a little overcooked but I don't mind. They seem to keep changing the menu a lot these days. My favorite is the peppercorn burger. Fish and chips are good as well. The freckled lemonade is always good. This place can get packed on the weekends though.

We come about once a month. Usually we get our food in a decent amount of time; sadly not tonight. Totally not our servers fault saw her actually working. I just was really in the mood for hot fries!! Ours were served luke warm and finally the cooks were able to get us some hot ones almost at the end of the meal. Just disappointed that's all.
We always get great service here. Try the banzai burger with a boca patty! Who can say no to all-you-can-eat fries?

Who doesn't love bottomless fries?  Their burgers are quite tasty and the beer is always fresh and cold.  Never doubt a good meal with warm hospitality and fast service.   A bit noisy,  kid friendly environment.   Usually have a ball game or 2 on the tv's!!

I haven't been to a Red Robins in.. forever. So I was looking forward to trying it again when my friends decided to head there for lunch.  The place was busy but we got seated right away.  I decided to get the Whiskey River BBQ chicken wrap based on my friends recommendation.  The food arrived fast and the wrap was pretty good. The right size. Not too big nor too small. The fries were gross! I really liked the fact that were also given two pieces of cantaloupe with the meals. Made you feel more healthy!  Would I go back again? Wouldn't be my first choice but would go if my friends suggested it. Much rather go here then across the street to TGI Fridays. Blah!

This is a great place to eat, I can't even count how many times I have been here!  The food comes in good portions, the staff is friendly, and the food is good.  And, I love that they have bottomless fries for when I am super hungry, I can get full for pretty cheap!  I absolutely love the California Chicken Sandwich, highly recommend it!  Also, if you don't want fries, you can substitute for a side salad or broccoli or fruit, etc at no additional cost.  The mint brownie shake is soooo good too...gotta give that one a try as well.  The downside to this place is their parking lot, it is ridiculous to try and find parking here, especially during peak times.
Good vegan burger, but no bread. Garlic fries are good.

When I went to this location I was made happy by the following: The food was nice, the Servers were nice,and the decor was pleasing.However, the bathrooms were not clean, the bacon was slightly under cooked, and the other  patrons were very rude

I have been here many of times,  but trust me I'm not a huge fan.  Honestly though this last time I went was really cool I went with a bunch of old friends so it made the experience a little more memerable it was great! Good food and a great time!  I had the prime rib burger it was pretty tasty, so if you get the chance check it out!

3 times in a row over the years bad service bad food.  Yesterday I decided to try one more time.  It took for ever and the burger was raw.  I went in at 3:00 PM so maybe the grill was done but you would think a hamburger place wouldn't have a problem cooking a hamburger
Always have great, speedy service here. The burgers are delicious and messy! The fries are the best, too. We eat here about once a month ;)

Since Roseville has a seemingly endless love affair for chain restaurants (Fridays and Applebees finally disappeared, boosting our city's dignity), at least the dirty bird provides me with what I consider heaven on a plate = unlimited, delicious, steak fries. that's all you need to know.

One of the best places for a burger...the beef is fresh and tasty, the unlimited fries are great. Service is always great. So efficient the tables are cleaned off before you leave the restaurant. We eat here about once a month for burgers and always leave satisfied.

I really love Red Robin, but this review is mainly for the service. I'm not sure why it seems we have 5 different servers helping us at once, but it gets really hectic in there! They bring out the food, and then another comes to check on you, another brings your condiments, and not one of them will remove the excess plates or glassware that pile up on your table. By the time we are done, we could barely see the other side of the table. I know I can eat and all, but it'd be nice to have some order of operation when eating at Red Robin. Nonetheless, I will still come here to eat their mozzarella sticks, mushroom burger, garlic fries, and freckled lemonade because it's just that good!

I went to Red Robin after a Hockey Game with my sister, her husband, my niece and her boyfriend.  We had a great time and I came away with an appreciation for the latest chain that wasn't half bad, in fact, it was pretty darn good. One thing, you know how I am about condiments... I love them and this place has about a thousand different dipping sauces.  They were all pretty good, but the best by far was the honey mustard with the poppy seeds.  I may not be able to urine test for a couple of weeks, but that is a small price to pay for delicious sauce! I had the fish and chips with salmon.  It was alright.  My brother in law had a pretty good looking salad.  The burgers that the others ordered looked pretty good too. We had a terrific waiter named Matt who willingly refilled everything, asked if we wanted more of anything, and didn't forget us, even though we were the only people out on the patio.  The big heaters kept us plenty warm and it was nice not to be in too stuffy a restaurant.  The bathrooms were nice and clean. This place was fun, great for a group and I am only taking a star because... it's a chain and the really was pretty middle of the road foodwise.  However, it's hard to please everyone in this picky family and these guys did a pretty decent job of feeding us. Heck yes, I'd go again in a red-hot minute!

Gross.  Save yourself $5-$8 and buy an In 'n Out cheeseburger/hamburger .  This place is cheesy (no pun intended) beyond words.  On the plus side the fries were pretty tasty and the server was pleasant and refilled my Ice Tea diligently. For my money, though, In 'n Out - or even Habit Burger - has got this place beat hands down - flavor-wise and price-wise.

I've never had better service in since I've moved to Roseville. Wasn't expecting it from a chain restaurant like Red Robin haha Never go without a drink or fries. It's not like the "endless fries" that you WAIT ENDLESSLY for. (see Islands) They dote on you here and the food is yummy.
I know I shouldn't want these burgers so much, but it's late and I can't stop thinking about the Whiskey River BBQ Burger.  If I didn't have three kids upstairs sleeping, I'd be in the car right now.

This may be a national chain, but I think they make some pretty rockin burgers. Steak fries dunked in house ranch are addictive. I really can't stand that there are a hundred freaking birthdays being celebrated every time I go- the clapping, the singing- blech. The chicken caprese sandwich bunless and wrapped in lettuce- yum yum yum. The kids love this place too (of course) and they can stuff their faces with all the fries they want. Their new rewards system is a little confusing, but rewards are worth the hassle. If you don't already have a rewards card, get one the moment you are in the door and use your phone to register online. You might just have a freebie for a free appetizer.

Red Robin actually cares to go the extra mile and make things right when they have had a wrong. RR has proven they actually care about their service and product and proved to me that they are better than the one bad experience. My next visit was the opposite of the previous visit. Great service good food. Thanks RR for showing me that I can feel comfortable again bringing my kids for their favorite burgers and fries etc. I will be back again!
I got food posioning from the roseville location, had to be admitted to the ER

Thanks red robin! My boyfriend and I went and had a nice quick bite here on a Tuesday night. It wasn't too busy luckily and we were seated immediately and served quickly! Our food was yummy and the fries were warm and delicious! We'll be back again.

My husband and I ate here this past Friday evening.  I got the Patty Melt with Fries.  The burger and bread were so greasy!  The fries were hard.  I was so disappointed. My husband got the Whiskey River burger and he liked it.  We went thirsty waiting for a refill, then waited a while for our bill.  Next time I'll be going to The Sand Bar in Harrison Township.  The burgers are awesome!  The martinis are also very good. The service is always prompt and friendly.

Awesome service!!  Fiod came fast even with the place super busy.  This place is almost always on top of it and the food is great.  I recommend this one over any other locations I have been too.  Our waitress Cayla was awesome and kept our drinks filled.

My husband and I LOVE this place. The service is AMAZING and the food is good. It's a great place to get a consistently good burger. We were so pleasantly surprised by the high quality service! Yum yum yum!

Good comfort food and fast friendly service, but daaaaaam is it loud in here.  The Whisky River Chicken Sandwich is my go to menu item.  Plan on enjoying the food, but dont plan on being able to carry on a conversation.

My sister and I went here for lunch today and this was our first visit to this restaurant. We were both really surprised and pleased with the great service and delicious food! We were greeted at the door when we entered and when we left. The Crispy Chicken Tender Salad was very tasty, as was the half BLTA sandwich and Chicken Tortilla Soup. We plan to go back! :)

How can you go wrong with BOTTOMLESS STEAK FRIES!?       I've eaten at this place for years, and just had a chance to dine there recently again. There really is no need to order appetizers when you've got BOTTOMLESS STEAK FRIES, but with my eyes being way too big for my stomach, I've tried many an appetizer on that menu . Spinach Dip = Great Buzzard Wings = Good (However, if you're looking for something spicy, this might not fulfill that craving. The spice level is a little less than mild.) Nachos = Can you really mess up nachos? Onion Rings = Great, wish there were more! Chicken strips = Mmm, moist and tender. The burgers there, equally as great. They're HUGE. I can barely get through half the burger before I'm full, or maybe that's because I usually munch on the steak fries in between bites     . My recommendations:  Royal Red Robin Burger 'Shroom Burger 5 Alarm Burger Whiskey BBQ Burger At least, those are the ones that I've tried and liked so far.    Oh, and just for a suggestion. Next time you go there, ask for a side of ranch, put some ketchup in it, and try the steak fries with the seasoned salt on it with it. A very yummy combination if I do say so myself. I hope you enjoy the place as much as I do.
This was the best personal service I have gotten in a while at any restaurant. The food was awesome too.

Here I go again. I am no longer ashamed of my love for good chain restaurants. I am unofficially Yelp's chain restaurant oficianado. Again, I LOATHE bad chains as much as any food snob, but I'm here to champion the ones who actually do it right, and most importantly- serve awesome tasting food. So, add RR to my list of top notch chains! Reasoning? Consistent, yet usually average service, BUT, the bottom line is that I LOVE the Banzai Burger, the fries, and all of the dipping sauces (buzz, 'o', honey mustard poppy, etc. etc. etc.). Taste is five-star to me, so this RR gets a five star rating from me.*  BTW if you haven't had the Banzai, it's the one with Pineapple, mayo, tomato, teriyaki, and cheddar on it. A few years ago when I first tried it I thought myself crazy, but after I did I was never the same. I've been here several times, and the ONLY time they didn't serve me a good burger (it was overcooked), they made me another one and didn't charge. I don't fault a place for making up for a seldom made mistake.  *If you order what I listed above. Otherwise, you are on your own!

Red Robin is pretty good for a chain restaurant. You can definitely find something for everyone. The food is mediocre to good. Don't come here expecting amazing gourmet burgers and you'll be satisfied with your meal.

The chicken wrap was great! Fry's are great and I'm a fry lover however I think the waitress could of brought one  more cup of salsa considering there was 3 of us sitting at the table. other than that good food good place.

Definitely a go to place for me and my family. The royal burger and the regular cheeseburger is always delicious. The main reason I love this place is the bottomless fries that you get for an appetizer with ranch. Love it!

Everytime I go here, the staff is always very nice and the food is delicious. When I was pregnant, I was hooked on their fries and strawberry lemonade. The server was so nice, he gave me a huge cup to take a refill home with me. As a pregnant woman, I was SOLD! Lol. Anyone who helps satisfy a pregnant woman's cravings gets an A in my book :)

Red Robin has become one of my favorite places to grab some food. For a large chain restaurant, the quality of their food is pretty high. All you can eat baskets of fries, burgers, salads.. It's all really good & they give the perfect size portions. The bleu ribbon burger is my fav! My mouth is watering as I write this review. To conclude.. If you are looking for some tasty reasonably priced American food & a fun atmosphere to eat it in, Red Robin is ideal.

Went here 2 days ago, very dissapointed.  My GF ordered a Prime Rib sandwhich with au juice.  I ordered a bacon cheeseburger and a clamchowder.  I was asked if I wanted "some pink or no pink" on my burger which is standard.   I asked for some pink.  Clam chowder came first which was great as usual.  When our entre's came out, we were both dissapointed.   The prime rib sandwhich was like biting into a bar of salt, and I'm a salt lover, yuk!   My burger was nearly rare, it was totally pink.  I ate my most of my burger dispite being rare, it tasted off, not like in the past.  My GF took one bite of the sandwhich and ate no more, it was just too salty.  While I'll miss the clam chowder, my GF has said we won't go to Red Robin again at any location, which sucks.
Delicious food! Friendly service. Only downside is it is always super busy.... whenever we go we have to park all the way by the Michael's parking lot.

We stopped here before heading across the street for the first match of the season for WTT.    My friend ordered a Whiskey River BBQ burger and I ordered a BLTA.   Very good.  Avocado was fresh and the fries were good.   Also enjoyed a Margarita. Juicy! If your looking for a good burger or sandwich, this is a convenient and good place to eat...
Huge fan. LOVE the bottomless fries.. Staff is extremely helpful and friendly. This is the best chain restaurant I've ever been to. Ever. Only drawback is the prices.

My wife and I regularly patronize Red Robin for lunch, primarily for three reasons:  1) it's in the middle of Roseville's retail center, 2) the service is typically both very friendly and very fast and 3) the chicken fajita salad, which is the ONLY menu item we've EVER eaten there, is great!  We always ask them to split the salad (no extra charge) and it's more than enough for lunch...at least for us.  But in fairness, we don't share the same waist size as most Red Robin patrons.  There are some BIG folks eating there.  And while most of them are likely there because of the bottomless fries, these folks clearly aren't bottomless themselves!   Once the Cheesecake Factory opens, we'll likely have to switch loyalties;  we love their BBQ chicken salad.

Mmmm.. yet another chain restaurant! Sometimes I wonder if Sacramento would up and die if all the chains went away. What would be left? I can't think of a single place that isn't a chain. But.. that's neither here nor there I suppose. Onto my review! Positives: - Decent burgers, good fries, yummy drinks. Typical of all red robins though, no? - Not too expensive for a decent burger and fries type place. Again, this is all red robins, not just this one. - Mostly clean, including the bathrooms. Which is a nice perk. Negatives: - Due to the proximity to the mall it's always packed. Expect to wait for a table. Also expect kids running around screaming while their parents ignore them. - Service is slow. This may be in part to understaffing, or whatever, but it's always slow. Also, don't ask for things that are out of the norm, i.e. no mayo or whatever, because it won't happen. - Parking sucks balls. Yeah, there is a lot, but I've NEVER found a spot in it. It shares the parking lot with two other very busy restaurants, so park near REI and get walking. So there you have it. It's decent. It's nothing great, but it could be worse. If you're craving a burger it's not a bad place to dine, until something new comes along.

hmm I love Red Robin. Not only do I have to agree that they have the a really good Whiskey River BBQ Chicken burger, but they do indeed have the best service! Recently, I came here with some friends to enjoy a nice Sunday dinner after hours of shopping across the street.  Our server took our order and brought some of their fries to our table.  A little while after taking our order and us having emptied the fry basket, he informed us that there was a mix up in the computer and would have to take our order again.   We were not happy campers.  He said he would see what he could do about a discount on our dinner, cause honestly were were ready to skip out. The manager came and she was probably the best manager I have ever encountered, she was friendly, understanding (our frustration), and bubbly.  She let us know that our dinner was going to be on the house, she got us some more fries, and assured us that our dinner would be first priority in the kitchen.   Can't beat the excellent service, the best strawberry lemonade and chicken burger (even though I never can finish it)!
Red Robin was the winner of the "Best Burger" (non fast food), in a recent "Sacramento Magazine" poll. This is an excellent example of a well-run chain restaurant.....

LOOOOOVE Red Robin!! I love the food and the atmosphere! The waitress was quick and on top of filing our drinks!   The only thing is we asked for 2 baskets of fries and only got one :(( And the hostess that sat us made me feel kind of awkward, like when you have crap in your teeth and no one tells you..........

We came in after church today and the place was not busy at all, we were seated right away and our server was right there to take our drink order. At that time, I asked for fries, he said no problem. Got our drinks, he took our order but no fries. Asked about it again when he came back and he said "as soon as they are done cooking, they will be right up". There were many tables around us that had been served fries but not us. I asked another server, who had brought our food, if we could possible get some. "no problem" again I was told. We were there for about an hour, never did get our fries or our ranch dressing for our salads. I confronted our server about all this, and he said "well, some of the orders have priority" I looked at him and said "no thats not true. we have asked you and other servers about this since we arrived and other tables have been served but not us". He got an attitude at that point and we paid our bill and left. Will not be back to this one. This was not the first time this has happened.

Tonight my husband and I had the most amazing and wonderful customer service experience with this Red Robin.  We decided to call in an order for takeout.  The gentleman on the phone said the food would be ready in 15 minutes.  We were all ready to go when our oldest son (age 3) decided he had to go potty.....#2.  30 minutes later we got in the car and were talking about how our food was probably really cold, especially considering it was a good 15 minutes until we would get there still.  I called Red Robin and the gentlemen said he understood, and that instead of re-heating the food for us they would COMPLETELY RE-MAKE IT.  We were in SHOCK.  I felt so guilty, but he assured us it was their pleasure.  When we got there to pick up the food I stayed in the car with the kids and my husband went in.  He said that everyone there was so kind and understood what our predicament had been.  it is so RARE to see customer service like that these days.  We were so appreciative and to top it off the food was AMAZING.  We couldn't be happier with our overall experience.

I think it's a sad and pathetic slap to the collective face of our city when we vote a corporate chain "restaurant" as having the best burger in Sacramento. If you actually follow Sacramento Magazine's 'Best Of' edition as a culinary and cultural guide to your environment, then you deserve to eat nothing but this shitty frozen food for the rest of your days.

Great place to bring the kids. Never had a bad meal here and they have changed their menu which is nice. Regular hang-out. Parking is tight, however, and you will have a wait on your hands Fridays and Saturdays, so get there early. A bit noisy, but it is what it is.

I'm not a burger and fry kind of girl, so this isnt really my kind of place. But the fries are good, and endless. There is usually a good 15-20 minute wait for a table (and even longer on the weekends since this location is next to the Galleria Mall). The atmosphere is busy and loud, but fun.
Excellent Burgers and service everytime!  I always get what I want in a timely manner and they put up with my picky-ness.

Service is always fast & friendly. We always bring our kids here for their birthdays because they really do it up right and we have never been let down. The kids love their big birthday sundaes and everybody singing happy birthday to them. Also was pleased to see that they have vegan boca burgers on the menu. Nice variety for everybody's taste.

Finding a place that I can take my children to dinner can be challenging, but this one is as good as it gets. The food is good, and they have healthy side dish options. They always bring us a basket of fries early so that the kids have something to eat right away. They also give free refills on any of the children's pasta dishes. We always go away happy and I don't have to worry about the children making too much noise.
Their food used to be tasty. The past few times my husband and I have been, there burgers have been so bland! Even their "Spicy" ones.  We haven't been back for the past year.
this location never lets me down. the food is perfect. the service is impeccable. they serve drinks. 'nough said.
